chunks.original_text: 赠堂下道人 意恶心顽烟火生，口张舌举是非生，伤人害己过潜生。 辩者自然为不善，善人不辩善芽生，无争上士得长生。 赠阎先生 舍了荣华物外居，的端妙处用功夫，坎离宫内弄清虚。 猛虎口中敲玉齿，骊龙领下夺神珠，这般手段称吾徒。 平等会本名相思会 继古韵 信口便胡轰，不管无腔调。 畅我情怀歌舞，一任人笑。 还童返老，志在无忧恼。 向妙处，下功搜，细勘校。 琼浆恣饮，元气充来饱。 锻炼神丹，无大无小。 胎仙养就，捧出灵芝草。 便自衒，这番儿，道决了。 洞中天本名鹧鸪天 寄呈马运甫 休赌休饮休保人，减些烟焰少婪尘。 能搜己过为长便，不见他非获好因。 惊宠辱，乐清贫，修心养性惜精神。 常凭如此成功行，明月清风作友真。 赠员先生#3 蓦想浮华痛我心，暂时荣显落沉沦。 争如物外逍遥客，岂似寰中自在人。 忘俗虑，乐清贫，住行坐卧啰哩□。 炼烹玉鼎长生药，保养金炉不死真。 赠昭然子 劝公休要恋迷津，华阳巾换皂罗巾。 不为汨没尘中客，得做逍遥物外人。 修道德，固精神，虎龙蟠绕啸吟频。 汞铅自是成丹药，跨鹤腾云礼至真。 全真庵丹井 穿凿须当二九深，甘泉自有应清吟。 更祈治病名丹井，相称山侗普济心。 人听劝，作知音，重阳妙趣好追寻。 紫芝气焰生形象，碧眼真如上宝岑。 玉楼春借柳词韵 赠云中子 洞天无夜还无曙，常有红光并紫雾。 灵波裹面见金鳌，背上银丝千万缕。 二神赑赑骖风驭，离坎相交传密语。 凿开造化至幽微，会得真功颠倒数。 寄长春子#4 何须求富并求贵，不必文章如白侍。 研穷性命好生涯，保惜根源真活计。 藏机隐密玄中最，肯向人前夸提对。 琼浆玉液饮千钟，霞友云朋酬一醉。 寄长安子 洞中日月无朝夕，晃朗云衢通宝陌。 上明紫脑承三清，下照黄河常五色。 自然霞结玲珑宅，内有长生三岛客。 未彰云外去时踪，已到眼前来显迹。 寄长真子 清中悟彻祥中瑞，堪做风仙端的裔。 广收白雪与黄芽，鍜炼神丹烹鼎沸。 灵童营养如琼腻，通晓玄玄真仔细。 明知天上二三年，暗换人间千万岁。 赠磻溪张先生 元阳烹炼金光阙，不使暗魔来盗窃。 常持清净有功能，永结神丹无漏泄。 闲心一片如冰雪，自有长生无夜月。 盖因离坎虎龙调，消尽我人猿马歇。 蓬莱阁本名秦楼月 赠山前谭二翁#5 谭公急，急迎物外逍遥客。 逍遥客，专来缘化，幸无阻隔。 焚烧船网无心测，四方称誉难名溺。 难名溺，诸余守旧，转增利息。 又 投玄急，投玄做个聪明客。
chunks.translated_text:
**To the Daoist Beneath the Hall**
Foul intentions and stubborn minds breed the smoke of the hearth,
gaping mouths and wagging tongues spawn right and wrong—
wounding others, harming oneself, transgressions arise in secret.

The contentious are naturally unkind,
the virtuous do not contend, and good sprouts grow—
the uncontentious superior person attains long life.

**To Master Yan**
Forsaking glory and splendor, dwelling beyond the material,
with focused effort in the wondrous and true,
within the Kan and Li palaces, playing with the pure and void.

Striking jade teeth in the tiger’s maw,
seizing the divine pearl from beneath the black dragon’s chin—
such skill is worthy of my disciple.

**The Equality Assembly (Originally Named the Longing Assembly)**
*Following the Ancient Rhyme*
Words spill carelessly, heedless of tune or measure,
yet I sing and dance to my heart’s content,
letting others laugh as they will.

Rejuvenating the old, returning to youth,
my aim is freedom from sorrow.
Toward the wondrous, I apply effort, searching,
examining closely.

Drinking ambrosia to my fill,
primordial qi swells, sating me.
Tempering the divine elixir,
neither great nor small.

The fetal immortal nurtured,
presents the magic mushroom.
Now, boasting of this,
at last, the Dao is attained.

**The Grotto Heaven (Originally Named Partridge Sky)**
*Sent to Ma Yunfu*
Abandon gambling, drinking, and vouching for others,
lessen the smoke and dust, reduce greed.
Searching for one’s own faults brings lasting benefit,
seeing not the faults of others reaps good causes.

Startled by neither favor nor disgrace,
delighting in purity and poverty,
cultivating the mind, nurturing nature, treasuring spirit.

Persisting thus in successful practice,
the bright moon and clear wind become true companions.

**To Master Yuan #3**
Suddenly recalling fleeting glory pains my heart,
brief honor and fame sink into oblivion.
How much better the carefree wanderer beyond the world,
unlike those bound within the realm, lacking freedom.

Forsaking worldly cares,
delighting in purity and poverty,
in walking, standing, sitting, lying—*lori*...
Refining the elixir of immortality in the jade crucible,
preserving the golden furnace’s deathless truth.

**To Zhaoranzi**
I urge you, do not cling to the deceptive ford,
exchange the Huayang turban for the black silk one.
Not to be drowned in the dust of the world,
but to become a carefree wanderer beyond the material.

Cultivating virtue and power,
fortifying spirit,
tigers and dragons coil and roar.
Mercury and lead naturally form the elixir,
riding the crane, soaring on clouds, paying homage to the Perfected.

**The Elixir Well of the Quanzhen Hermitage**
Digging must reach eighteen feet deep,
sweet springs naturally respond with clear song.
Further, it heals illness—named the Elixir Well,
befitting the mountain recluse’s heart of universal salvation.

Let people heed advice,
become knowing friends,
pursuing the wondrous subtleties of Chongyang.
Purple *zhi*’s radiance shapes form,
the blue-eyed true suchness ascends the jeweled peak.

**Jade Tower Spring (Borrowing the Willow Lyric’s Rhyme)**
*To the Cloud Dweller*
The grotto heaven knows no night nor dawn,
only crimson light and purple mist.
Within the numinous waves, the golden turtle appears,
a thousand strands of silver silk upon its back.

Two spirits, diligent, harness the wind’s chariot,
Kan and Li merge, whispering secrets.
Carving open creation to its subtlest depths,
mastering the true work’s inverted numbers.

**To the Eternal Spring Child #4**
Why seek wealth or nobility?
No need for prose like Bai’s.
Delving into nature and destiny is a fine livelihood,
cherishing the root’s source is the true way to live.

Hiding the mechanism in profound secrecy,
unwilling to boast before others.
Drinking jade nectar by the thousand cups,
cloud friends and rosy companions toast in one intoxication.

**To the Chang’an Child**
Within the grotto, sun and moon know no day or night,
radiant cloud thoroughfares connect jeweled paths.
Above, the purple brain receives the Three Clarities,
below, the Yellow River shines in five colors.

Naturally, rosy clouds weave a delicate abode,
within dwell the immortals of the Three Isles.
Before their traces beyond the clouds are revealed,
they have already arrived before our eyes.

**To the Perfected Truth Child**
In clarity, awakening to auspicious omens,
worthy to be the true heir of the Wind Immortal.
Gathering white snow and yellow sprouts,
forging the divine elixir, the crucible seethes.

The numinous youth, nourished like jade cream,
understands the profoundest mysteries in detail.
Knowing that two or three years in heaven
secretly exchange for ten thousand ages among men.

**To Master Zhang of Panxi**
Refining primordial yang in the golden palace,
preventing dark demons from stealing.
Maintaining purity yields merit,
eternally congealing the divine elixir without leakage.

A heart at leisure, pure as ice and snow,
naturally possesses the deathless moon without night.
Because Kan and Li’s tiger and dragon harmonize,
the human monkey and horse within me are stilled.

**Penglai Pavilion (Originally Named Moon over Qin Tower)**
*To the Two Elders Tan Before the Mountain*
Elder Tan, hasten!
Hasten to welcome the carefree wanderer beyond the world.
Carefree wanderer,
come to transform through affinity,
fortunately unobstructed.

Burning boats and nets, beyond calculation,
four directions praise, yet words fail to describe.
Words fail to describe,
all else clings to the old,
only increasing profit.

Again, hasten to the mysterious,
hasten to become a wise wanderer.

**Reusing the Previous Rhyme**
Nurturing the three elixirs, yet not idle,
transforming people to enter the Dao, recognizing true leisure—
true joy, true bliss, responding to true idleness.
Further refining the three elixirs into one,

chunks.original_text: 聪明客，静清心月，不教云隔。 死生生死无人测，效予入道能超溺。 能超溺，虎蟠龙远，性停命息。 赠谭公 于郎急，留心长在船头客。 船头客，杀鱼鰕命，罪根非隔。 把予言语休胡测，速烧船网冤魂溺。 冤魂溺，要全灵物，踵间通息。 又 熬煎急，熬煎煎逼熬煎客。 熬煎客，妻男魔障，妙玄墙隔。 遇予便把清凉测，清凉路上难缘溺。 难缘溺，气通和气，息调传息。 赠谭公子 人人急，人人海上为船客。 为船客，业缘长做，福缘长隔。 遇予劝化深宜测，焚烧船网难功溺。 难功溺，福缘善庆，业缘除息。 又 □ 猿急，□猿不动真吾客。 真吾客，口传灵榭，□金间隔。 □真修炼非凡测，□珠光莹难尘溺。 难尘溺，□生灵焰，□ 消烟息。 拆心字起。 赞重阳真人 离西漠，重阳来访蓬莱阁。 蓬莱阁，祥光浮动，果然侵廓。 阐扬教典胜施药，道尊自是师严恶。 师严恶，僻人归正，要超碧落。 述怀 离沙漠，顿忘宁海军中阁。 军中阁，我无回顾，志清天廓。 虚无撮住堪丸药，虎龙哮吼从教恶。 从教恶，劝人修道，救人崖落。 赞尹真人 无烟漠，集仙观裹飞仙阁。 飞仙阁，巍巍高耸，半侵云廓。 尹真法体方圆药，人还心敬消诸恶。 消诸恶，本来灵物，免教流落。 咏海市 云烟漠，红光紫雾成楼阁。 成楼阁，鸾飞凤舞，往来琼廓。 神仙队仗迎丹药，虚无造化龙生恶。 龙生恶，蓬莱三岛，横铺碧落。 借张修祖殿试韵 还乡急，关西牒发山东客。 山东客，三千余里，关山遥隔。 当时枉把予闲测，而今且恁身如溺。 身如溺，他年重话，修仙真息。 赠马彦高 都同急，务场无本为愁客。 为愁客，祷他官长，免教亏隔。 遇予咒酒忘忧测，能医百病如扶溺。 如扶溺，更宜规措，自然增息。 赠吴庵师 庵师急，庵师和尚迎仙客。
chunks.translated_text:
The wise wanderer,
still and clear as the heart-moon,
lets no clouds obstruct.
Death and life, life and death—none can fathom,
yet those who follow me into the Dao transcend drowning.
Transcend drowning,
tiger coils, dragon soars far,
nature rests, life breath stills.

*To Elder Tan*
Hasten, Master Yu!
Keep your heart ever with the boatman.
Boatman,
slaying fish and shrimp takes lives,
sin’s root is never distant.
Take my words—cease wild conjecture,
quickly burn boats and nets to free drowned souls.
Free drowned souls,
to preserve the numinous being,
heel to crown, breath flows unbroken.

*Again*
Hasten through the crucible,
through the crucible’s pressing torment, the crucible’s wanderer.
Crucible’s wanderer,
wife and sons—demonic obstructions,
the wondrous mystery’s wall divides.
Meet me, and grasp the cool clarity,
on the path of cool clarity, hard to drown in karmic ties.
Hard to drown,
qi harmonizes with harmonious qi,
breath regulates, transmission breathes.

*To Master Tan’s Disciple*
Hasten, all people!
All people on the sea become boatmen.
Become boatmen,
karmic bonds ever bind,
blessed affinity ever distant.
Meet me, heed my exhortation deeply,
burn boats and nets—hard to merit drowning.
Hard to merit drowning,
blessed affinity brings felicity,
karmic bonds dissolve, breath stills.

*Again*
□ Hasten, ape!
□ Ape, unmoved—true guest of mine.
True guest of mine,
orally transmit the numinous terrace,
□ gold’s interval divides.
□ Truly cultivate and refine—no common conjecture,
□ pearl’s radiance gleams, hard to drown in dust.
Hard to drown in dust,
□ life’s numinous flame,
□ smoke dissipates, breath stills.
*Dismantle the character "heart" to begin.*

*In Praise of True Man Chongyang*
Leaving the western desert,
Chongyang came to visit Penglai Pavilion.
Penglai Pavilion,
auspicious light drifts,
truly vast and boundless.
Expounding scriptures surpasses dispensing medicine,
the Dao’s honor is naturally the master’s stern majesty.
Master’s stern majesty,
wayward people return to rectitude,
to ascend the azure vault.

*Expressing My Feelings*
Leaving the desert sands,
suddenly forgetting the pavilion within Ninghai’s army.
Within the army’s pavilion,
I turn back no glance,
aspiration clear as the sky’s expanse.
Emptiness and nothingness gather the pellet elixir,
tiger and dragon roar as they please.
As they please,
exhort people to cultivate the Dao,
to save people from the precipice.

*In Praise of True Man Yin*
From the smokeless desert,
within the Immortals’ Gathering Abbey, the Flying Immortal Pavilion.
Flying Immortal Pavilion,
towering and lofty,
half invading the clouds’ expanse.
True Man Yin’s dharma-body, the square-and-round elixir,
people’s reverent hearts dissolve all evil.
Dissolve all evil,
originally numinous beings,
spared from drifting and falling.

*Ode to the Mirage*
Clouds and mist obscure,
crimson light and purple haze form towers and pavilions.
Form towers and pavilions,
phoenixes dance, simurghs fly,
coming and going through the jade expanse.
Immortal retinues welcome the cinnabar elixir,
emptiness and nothingness transform—dragons give birth to majesty.
Dragons give birth to majesty,
Penglai’s three isles,
spread across the azure vault.

*Matching the Rhyme of Zhang Xiuzu’s Palace Examination*
Hasten home!
A traveler from Shandong, dispatched by a document from the west.
Shandong traveler,
three thousand li and more,
passes through distant mountains and barriers.
At that time, vainly guessing my idle thoughts,
now my body is like one drowning.
Like one drowning,
in later years, again speak of
the immortal’s true breath.

*To Ma Yangao*
Hasten together!
In the marketplace, penniless—becoming a sorrowful wanderer.
Becoming a sorrowful wanderer,
praying to officials and superiors,
to avoid loss and separation.
Meet me, recite the spell over wine to forget sorrow,
curing a hundred illnesses like rescuing the drowning.
Like rescuing the drowning,
further arrange and plan,
naturally increasing breath.

*To Abbot Wu’an*
Hasten, Abbot!
Abbot, monk welcoming the immortal guest.

chunks.original_text: 迎仙客，香烟缭绕，把予眸隔。 如麻观者难筹测，良缘共结功无溺。 功无溺，龙华三会，熙熙消息。 赠门人 修仙急，超然一志非常客。 非常客，值魔遭难，荡关冲隔。 精微妙处心头测，转增开悟难迷溺。 难迷溺，鹑居鷇食，念忘情息。 赠赵公 当周急，惯曾为侣偏怜客。 偏怜客，成人之美，自无障隔。 遇予好把精微测，拯危救苦扶持溺。 扶持溺，自然通道，气神和息。 劝宋公辅 儒家急，儒家不悟行尸客。 行尸客，钻研活路，无遮无隔。 令人泛海夸强测，岂思风浪扁舟溺。 扁舟溺，此般宁忍，劝君休息。 劝回 休急急，儒家本是蓬瀛客。 蓬瀛客，谪居尘世，暂时仙隔。 亘初一点殷懃测，搜来端正难焚溺。 难焚溺，回光返照，修真调息。 赠宋六郎 波波急，波波急急忧愁客。 忧愁客，恩山爱海，万遮千隔。 遇予出路须当测，利名场上休投溺。 休投溺，进修仙道，尘情俱息。 又 宋六急，急谋生计为船客。 为船客，洪波大浪，并无遮隔。 风涛恶处如何测，好烧船网堤防溺。 堤防溺，不如闲坐，谩调龟息。 赠姑水迟二翁 迟二急，代予开导为知客。 为知客，劝人归善，不辞山隔。 人焚船网何曾测，这般功行诚难溺。 诚难溺，名传世上，自然无息。 又 修持急，修持裹面真宾客。 真宾客，内怀心镜，暂时形隔。 要通灵显须凭测，亘初悟彻能离溺。 能离溺，自然昭着，万缘齐息。 赠邴三翁联珠 邴三急，〔急〕随物外修真客。 修真客，〔客〕听予劝，〔劝〕公尘隔。 〔隔〕尘自是能真测，〔测〕真修炼难归溺。 难归溺，〔溺〕沉无虑，〔虑〕忘猿息。 又 迷迷急，气财酒色愚痴客。 愚痴客，遇予回首，一齐拨隔。 搜玄搜妙深深测，玄机既悟何愁溺。 何愁溺，鼻调真气，往来匀息。 赠看焚船网人 行化急，堪嗟背道愚迷客。 愚迷客，是非海裹，利名关隔。 遇予速把玄玄测，澄心绝虑难情溺。 难情溺，精光神气，终身将息。 又 人来急，相随相从林泉客。 林泉客，化人行善，业缘拦隔。 网船焚毁无疑测，慈悲功行难为溺。 难为溺，看人获福，杀心皆息。 赠门人 知心急，佩韦做个超凡客。 超凡客，万缘堆裹，超然离隔。 逍遥物外玄机测，炼成丹宝无忧溺。 无忧溺，猿心马意，自然停息。 赤岸桥头劝烧船网 缘行急，前迎后送仙家客。 仙家客，幢旛宝盖，香花相隔。 数船网罟焚无测，度仙桥上难沉溺。 难沉溺，济人道路，往来宁息。 赠于疃化网杨法师 行法急，留心行法奔波客。 奔波客，外行救治，内忘通隔。 木金三间当搜测，居於物外能趖溺。 能趖溺，气和神畅，子安母息。 又 行法急，斩妖断祟书符客。 书符客，振威叱喝，有伤和隔。 遇予好把修行测，修仙自是无仙溺。 无仙溺，盖因修炼，念忘心息。 劝道 □魔急，□魔怎乱修仙客。 修仙客，□谈玄妙，□男远隔。 □求寸禄人休测，□乡无漏难漂溺。 难漂溺，□仪运转，□行真息。 拆心字起。 洞玄金玉集卷之九竟 #1以下五首词牌应为『镇西』。 #2以下十七首词牌均为『浣溪沙』。 #3以下三首词牌为『鹧鸪天』。 #4以下四首词牌为『玉楼春』。 #5以下三十首词牌均为『秦楼月』，又名『忆秦娥』。 洞玄金玉集卷之十 金莲出玉花本名减字木兰花

**To the Abbot Wu’an (continued)**
Hasten, immortal guest!
Incense smoke curling, veiling my gaze.
Like hemp-seeds in vision—hard to fathom,
yet a true bond is forged, merit never drowned.
Merit never drowned,
at the Dragon Flower’s three assemblies,
joyful tidings arise.

*To a Disciple*
Hasten in Dao cultivation!
Transcend with singular resolve—no ordinary guest.
No ordinary guest,
facing demons and trials,
shattering barriers and blockades.
In the subtle and wondrous, probe the heart’s depths,
turning deeper awakening far from drowning.
Far from drowning,
like the quail’s nest, the fledgling’s feed,
thoughts forgotten, passions stilled.

*To Lord Zhao*
Hasten in this age!
Ever the companion, cherishing the guest.
Cherishing the guest,
perfecting others’ virtue,
naturally without obstruction.
Meet me, grasp the profound and subtle,
rescuing peril, upholding the drowning.
Upholding the drowning,
naturally the Dao flows,
qi and spirit harmonize, at rest.

*Exhortation to Minister Song*
Hasten, Confucian!
Confucian, unenlightened—a walking corpse.
A walking corpse,
burrowing for livelihood,
without veil or barrier.
Men boast of braving the sea’s vastness,
yet who ponders the skiff drowned in wind and waves?
The skiff drowned—
how can this be endured?
I urge you: cease and rest.

*Exhortation to Return*
Do not hasten so!
Confucians are but Penglai’s guests,
Penglai’s guests,
exiled in the dusty world,
temporarily parted from immortality.
From the primal origin, a single earnest thought—
search it true, hard to burn or drown.
Hard to burn or drown,
turn the light inward, reflect,
cultivate the true, regulate the breath.

*To Song Liulang*
Hasten, wave upon wave!
Hasten, wave upon wave—anxious guest.
Anxious guest,
bound by mountains of grace, seas of love,
a thousand veils, ten thousand barriers.
Meet me, find the path you must,
in the realm of fame and profit—do not drown.
Do not drown,
advance in Dao cultivation,
worldly passions all stilled.

*Again to Song Liulang*
Hasten, Song!
Hastily scheming livelihood—a boatman’s guest.
A boatman’s guest,
amidst towering waves,
no shelter, no barrier.
Where winds and billows rage—how to fathom?
Better burn the nets and rigging to guard against drowning.
Guard against drowning,
or sit idly,
idly regulating the tortoise’s breath.

*To the Two Elders of Gushui, Chi*
Hasten, you two!
Taking my place to guide—knowing guests.
Knowing guests,
urging others toward goodness,
unafraid of mountain divides.
When men burn nets and boats—who could have foreseen?
Such merit and conduct truly hard to drown.
Truly hard to drown,
names transmitted through the world,
naturally without end.

*Again on Cultivation*
Hasten in practice!
Within cultivation—true honored guests.
True honored guests,
inwardly holding the heart’s mirror,
temporarily veiled in form.
To penetrate the numinous, rely on probing,
from the primal origin, awakening fully—able to depart drowning.
Able to depart drowning,
naturally radiant,
all karmic ties stilled.

*To Elder Bing San, "Linked Pearls"*
Hasten, Bing San!
Hasten beyond the world—cultivating the true guest.
Cultivating the true guest,
hear my exhortation,
the world’s dust veils you.
The dust—yet you can truly fathom,
true cultivation hard to return to drowning.
Hard to return to drowning,
sink without care,
forget the ape’s breath, still the mind.

*Again*
Hasten, lost one!
Bound by qi, wealth, wine, lust—foolish guest.
Foolish guest,
meet me, turn your head,
all barriers swept away.
Search the profound, search the wondrous—deeply probe,
the mystery grasped—what drowning to fear?
What drowning to fear?
Nose regulating true qi,
evenly flowing, at rest.

*To Those Burning Nets and Boats*
Hasten in teaching!
Alas, those turning from the Dao—deluded guests.
Deluded guests,
in the sea of right and wrong,
blocked by fame and profit’s gates.
Meet me, swiftly grasp the mysterious,
clarify the heart, sever thoughts—hard to drown in passion.
Hard to drown in passion,
essence, light, spirit, qi,
lifelong nurtured.

*Again*
Hasten, people come!
Following, accompanying—forest and spring guests.
Forest and spring guests,
transforming others toward goodness,
karmic ties obstructing.
Nets and boats burned—no doubt to fathom,
compassionate merit hard to drown.
Hard to drown,
watching others gain fortune,
killing intent all stilled.

*To a Disciple*
Hasten, kindred spirit!
Gird with soft leather—a transcendent guest.
Transcendent guest,
amidst a thousand karmic ties,
transcending, apart.
Carefree beyond the world, probing the mystery,
refining the elixir’s treasure—no sorrow, no drowning.
No sorrow, no drowning,
monkey mind, horse intent,
naturally stilled.

*At Chian Bridge, Exhorting the Burning of Nets and Boats*
Hasten in karmic conduct!
Welcoming ahead, sending behind—immortal guests.
Immortal guests,
banners and jeweled canopies,
fragrant flowers veiling.
Countless nets and traps burned—beyond measure,
on the Immortal Crossing Bridge—hard to sink or drown.
Hard to sink or drown,
aiding others on the path,
coming and going, at peace.

*To Yang the Dharma Master of Yutuan, Transforming Nets*
Hasten in dharma practice!
Devoted to dharma—a wandering guest.
Wandering guest,
outwardly saving and healing,
inwardly forgetting barriers.
Between wood and metal—search and probe,
abiding beyond the world—able to escape drowning.
Able to escape drowning,
qi harmonized, spirit flowing,
child at peace, mother at rest.

*Again*
Hasten in dharma practice!
Slaying demons, breaking curses—talisman-wielding guest.
Talisman-wielding guest,
shaking might, shouting commands,
harming harmony, creating divides.
Meet me, grasp cultivation well,
cultivating immortality—naturally no immortal’s drowning.
No immortal’s drowning,
through cultivation,
thoughts forgotten, heart stilled.

*Exhortation to Dao Cultivators*
Hasten, □demons!
□demons, how dare you disturb Dao-cultivating guests?
Dao-cultivating guests,
□discussing the profound,
□men far apart.
□seeking inches of rank—do not probe,
□homeland without leakage—hard to drift or drown.
Hard to drift or drown,
□rites revolving,
□practicing true breath.

*Breaking the Character "Heart" to Begin*

**End of *Dongxuan Jin Yu Ji*, Scroll Nine**

#1 The following five lyrics are set to the tune *Zhenxi*.
#2 The following seventeen lyrics are set to the tune *Huanxisha*.
#3 The following three lyrics are set to the tune *Zhegutian*.
#4 The following four lyrics are set to the tune *Yulouchun*.
#5 The following thirty lyrics are all set to the tune *Qinlouyue*, also known as *Yi Qin’e*.

**Dongxuan Jin Yu Ji, Scroll Ten**
*Golden Lotus Emerging from Jade Flower* (originally titled *Jianzi Mulan Hua*)

*To Ma Yangao*
Hasten together!
In the marketplace, penniless—becoming a sorrowful wanderer.
Becoming a sorrowful wanderer,
praying to officials and superiors,
to avoid loss and separation.
Meet me, recite the spell over wine to forget sorrow,
curing a hundred illnesses like rescuing the drowning.
Like rescuing the drowning,
further arrange and plan,
naturally increasing breath.

*To Abbot Wu’an*
Hasten, Abbot!
Abbot, monk welcoming the immortal guest.

chunks.original_text: 赠大毕先生 毕公好志，官障私魔心不二。 决烈修持，能可移山志不移。 尘缘一削，世上荣华无染着。 可称仙徒，堪许完全大药炉。 劝刘法司放鹦鹉#1 绿毛红觜，因为能言还自累。 奉劝休何，语得分明愈着魔。 不如省觉，缄口藏机怀卓荦。 人总嫌伊，得出凡笼自在飞。 寄张知观 张公知观，性命堪搜常作观。 勘破嚣尘，灰了凡心出世尘。 内修内炼，真汞真铅常锻炼。 要见金莲，须是深深种玉莲。 寄任节级 任公节级，肯救危难常济急。 此去淳于，报得专专献钵盂。 山东马钰，词寄贤家收养玉。 玉裹生金、无口能言话古今。 赠刘公见惠鞋以词赠之 赠予鞋履，我赐贤家玄妙理。 休别猜疑，早离尘缘得所宜。 论其元首，清净精光牢固守。 性不沉流，决继海蟾的祖刘。 姜公惠蒲扇 蒲编线定，救苦成功生异景。 热恼无忧，招引风来夏变秋。 休言是草，虽则物轻人意好。 感谢姜侯，惠我清凉免上楼。 又 □金汞定，□富人荣非我景。 □子何忧，□叹浮生鬓染秋。 □生慧草，□早修心端的好。 □道胜侯，□袖携云访玉楼。 拆木字起。 莱州仓使卢武义 卢公仓使，意在留心风马二。 未解修丹，送我劳劳到武官。 速回车马，欲要全真先弃假。 功行须周，定是将来看十洲。 又 直饶呼使，怎比清清修不二。 会炼三丹，远胜为人得好官。 牢擒意马，紧锁心猿宁着假。 灵物圆周，得看壶中万万洲。 赠清净庵主刘公 彭城庵主，喜舍花园庵舍做。 设此良缘，种下将来福禄田。 全家修善，正是修行真地面。 更好清心，神气冲和上宝岑。 赠刘同监 □圭烂饮，□后玄机宜再审。 □上田田，□了真功得自然。 □中莲绽，□是为仙无失陷。 □了心休，□继海蟾的祖刘。 拆刀字起。 继张修祖殿试韵 □传天际，□小金婴能补缀。 □白绒清，□物随针绣我心。 □灵无影，□八刀圭谁可饮。 □友张翁，□客邀观七宝宫。 拆□字起。 继酒同监韵联珠 〔休〕心数岁，〔岁〕久休心成妙最。 〔最〕好心磨，〔磨〕琢心开疾似梭。 〔梭〕飞玉性，〔性〕上无瑕真自净。 〔净〕有何愁，〔愁〕恼吾官心不休。 清真子姚公索 命中养性，水裹生金真本柄。 虎绕龙蟠，走玉飞金结作团。 刀圭恣饮，产个胎仙端更正。 别是生涯，出入腾空步翠霞。 赠范明叔□扇 □丝为扇，堪与闲人常作善。 惊说蚊蝇，款款轻摇免杀生。 添成幽雅，相助逍遥尘不惹。 拂尽攀缘，意净心清性月圆。 于疃于吉先索 于公听劝，世事无涯难历徧。 好认玄微，稍稍知空达妙机。 家缘撇掉，云水遨游修大道。 异日功成，跨鹤携云赴玉京。 〔劝刘稳〕 牟平县刘稳欲自焚身，遂作此词，急救其性命。 刘公听劝，学佛修仙凭识见。 割弃心尘，不在焚烧舍身。 些儿修炼，锻炼神丹须九转。 功行圆周，相继海蟾的祖刘。 姜公惠故纸 □然传旨，□下清吟专谢纸。 □帛迁延，□笔书笺镢见前。 □开微寡，□擘悭心当舍下。 □惠群仙，□却酬君诗百篇。 拆丿字起。 桃源忆故人 重阳师父相引登蓬莱阁 风仙同我蓬莱宴，〔赏〕玩蓬莱清浅。 海市蓬莱出现，虎啸蓬莱苑。 龙吟蟠绕蓬莱殿，鹤驭蓬莱凤辇。 丹显蓬莱九转，堪应蓬莱选。 又 昆箭山近蓬莱廓，连接蓬莱云脚。 异景蓬莱辉霍，霞变蓬莱鹤。 金风吹转蓬莱阁，自有蓬莱丹药。
chunks.translated_text:
**To Master Da Bi**
Master Bi, noble in aspiration,
barred both official hindrance and private demon—heart undivided.
Fierce in resolve, steadfast in cultivation,
able to move mountains—yet his will never wavers.
Worldly ties once severed,
earthly glory leaves no stain.
Worthy to be called a Daoist disciple,
fit to perfect the great elixir furnace.

**Admonishing Magistrate Liu to Release the Parrot**
Green-feathered, red-beaked,
for its gift of speech it only brings itself trouble.
I urge you, cease this—
the clearer its words, the deeper the delusion.
Better to awaken,
seal its beak, hide its cunning, and cherish its brilliance.
All despise it now,
but once freed from the mortal cage, it flies at ease.

**To Master Zhang Zhiguan**
Master Zhang, ever observing,
searches life and destiny, ever watchful.
Seeing through the clamor of dust,
he extinguishes the mortal heart and transcends worldly dust.
Within, he refines and tempers,
true mercury and true lead ever forged.
To behold the golden lotus,
one must deeply plant the jade lotus.

**To Captain Ren**
Captain Ren,
ever rescuing the distressed, ever aiding the urgent.
Departing now for Chunyu,
he repays wholeheartedly with alms-bowl offerings.
Ma Yu of Shandong,
sends words to this worthy household to nurture jade.
Within jade, gold is born—
though mute, it speaks of ancient and modern.

**To Master Liu, Who Bestowed Shoes**
Bestowing shoes upon me,
I grant you, worthy one, the mystery of the profound.
Do not doubt or hesitate—
early sever worldly ties to find what is fitting.
Discussing its origin,
pure and radiant essence is firmly guarded.
Nature does not sink or drift,
resolutely following the lineage of Patriarch Liu, the Sea Toad.

**To Master Jiang, Who Bestowed a Palm-Leaf Fan**
Woven with sturdy reeds,
it relieves suffering and brings forth wondrous scenes.
Heat and vexation vanish—
summoning the wind, summer turns to autumn.
Say not it is mere grass,
though light in substance, it delights the heart.
Grateful to Lord Jiang,
who bestowed coolness, sparing me the climb upstairs.

**Another**
□gold and mercury settled,
□wealth and honor—no scene of mine.
□why worry?
□lamenting fleeting life, temples touched by autumn.
□wisdom’s grass sprouts,
□early cultivate the heart—truly the best.
□Dao surpasses nobility,
□sleeve carries clouds to visit the jade tower.

*Breaking the Character "Wood" to Begin*

**To Granary Officer Lu Wuyi of Laizhou**
Officer Lu,
intent on keeping heart and horse in check.
Yet to refine the elixir,
he sends me wearily to Wu Pass.
Swiftly turn back carriage and horse—
to preserve the true, first abandon the false.
Deeds and conduct must be complete,
then surely one will gaze upon the Ten Isles.

**Another**
Even if summoned to serve,
how compares it to pure cultivation, undivided?
Mastering the three elixirs,
far surpasses gaining high office.
Firmly restrain the mind-horse,
tightly bind the heart-ape—let no falsehood remain.
When the numinous substance is perfected,
one beholds within the gourd myriad isles.

**To Abbot Liu of Pure Tranquility Hermitage**
Abbot of Pengcheng Hermitage,
joyfully donates a garden to build the hermitage.
Establishing this good affinity,
planting a field of future blessings and fortune.
The whole family cultivates goodness,
truly the ground of Daoist practice.
Better still, purify the heart—
spirit and qi harmoniously ascend the precious peak.

**To Supervisor Liu**
□jade and feast,
□afterward, the mystery should be re-examined.
□upper field, lush,
□true work yields spontaneity.
□within, the lotus blooms,
□this is the way to immortality—no loss or fall.
□once the heart is stilled,
□follow the lineage of Patriarch Liu, the Sea Toad.

*Breaking the Character "Knife" to Begin*

**Following Master Zhang’s Rhyme for the Palace Examination**
□transmitted from heaven’s edge,
□tiny golden infant can mend and patch.
□white silk, pure,
□substance follows the needle, embroidering my heart.
□numinous, without shadow,
□eight-knife jade—who may drink?
□friend Zhang,
□guest invited to view the Seven Treasures Palace.

*Breaking the Character □ to Begin*

**Linked Pearls Following Supervisor Jiu’s Rhyme**
Rest the heart for years,
years long, rest the heart to achieve the subtlest wonder.
Wonderful to grind the heart,
polishing it open, swift as a shuttle.
Shuttle flies, jade nature—
nature flawless, truly pure and clean.
Pure, what sorrow?
Sorrow and vexation—my heart never rests.

**Pure Truth Master Yao Requests a Lyric**
Destiny nurtures nature,
within water, gold is born—true root and handle.
Tiger coils, dragon entwines,
running jade, flying gold, congealing into a mass.
Freely drink the jade powder,
giving birth to an embryo immortal, upright and correct.
A life apart—
entering and exiting, soaring through emerald clouds.

**To Fan Mingshu, Who Bestowed a Fan**
□silk woven into a fan,
fit for the idle to perpetually do good.
Startling the mention of mosquitoes and flies,
gently fanning to spare lives.
Enhancing quiet elegance,
aiding carefree wandering, untouched by dust.
Brushing away entanglements,
the mind is clear, the heart pure, the nature-moon full.

**To Yu Tuan and Yu Ji, Who First Requested**
Master Yu, heed my advice—
worldly affairs are boundless, hard to traverse fully.
Better to recognize the subtle mystery,
gradually understand emptiness and grasp the wondrous mechanism.
Cast aside family ties,
roam as clouds and water, cultivate the great Dao.
One day, when merit is complete,
ride a crane, carry clouds, and ascend to Jade Capital.

**Admonishing Liu Wen of Mouping County**
Liu Wen of Mouping County wished to immolate himself—
I hastily composed this lyric to save his life.
Master Liu, heed my advice—
learning Buddhism or cultivating immortality depends on insight.
Sever the dust from the heart,
not through burning or discarding the body.
A little refinement,
forging the spirit elixir requires nine revolutions.
When merit and conduct are complete,
follow the lineage of Patriarch Liu, the Sea Toad.

**To Master Jiang, Who Bestowed Used Paper**
□transmitting the decree,
□below, pure chanting—grateful for the paper.
□silk delayed,
□brush writes letters, hoe seen before.
□opening the meager,
□tearing stinginess, casting it aside.
□bestowing upon immortals,
□I shall repay you with a hundred poems.

*Breaking the Character "Stroke" to Begin*

**Remembering an Old Friend to the Tune *Taoyuan Yiguren***
Master Chongyang led us to ascend Penglai Pavilion.
Immortal Feng and I feast at Penglai,
delighting in Penglai’s clarity and shallowness.
The mirage of Penglai appears,
tigers roar in Penglai’s gardens.
Dragons chant, coiling around Penglai’s halls,
crane chariots and Penglai’s phoenix carriages.
The elixir, revealed through Penglai’s nine revolutions,
worthy to meet Penglai’s selection.

**Another**
Kun Jian Mountain near Penglai’s outskirts,
connected to Penglai’s cloud feet.
Wondrous scenes of Penglai gleam,
rosy clouds transform Penglai’s cranes.
Golden winds blow, turning Penglai’s pavilion—
naturally, Penglai’s elixir is present.

chunks.original_text: 仙子蓬莱真乐，不负蓬莱约。 又 马风得遇修仙举，不羡人间富贵。 筑个环墙居住，且避风霜雨。 灵光昼夜常修补，异日功成归去。 得住蓬莱洞府，侍奉吾师父。 寄谭刘郝三师友#2 谭风刘郝云霞友，自在逍遥闲走。 兴尽好归陕右，共话无中有。 常清常净常无漏，便觉虎龙交媾。 个内不神神秀，得饮长生酒。 得遇 马风曩日肥家子，缘甚黜妻屏子。 便做飘蓬贫子，因遇重阳子。 从斯道号丹阳子，尘事并无些子。 悟彻男儿产子，决定成仙子。 自悟 父兄未老先亡过，已后不须发课。 决定轮排到我，生死如何躲。 悟来便做飍飍么，一任人猜心破。 认正个中些个，有分携云朵。 思辽阳高巨才 桃源忆故人归去，别后常怀无绪。 未审官游何处，忘了当初遇。 我今物外修行做，但愿他家开悟。 猛弃荣华贵富，共结云霞侣。 赠孔庵主昆仲 孔公四个亲兄弟，小者二人倾逝。 已后不须卜筮，想着先垂泪。 死生生死如何避，早把家缘猛弃。 物外行功积累，得得成仙位。 劝长安三坛李法师 李公知观听予劝，只恁未为长便。 悟取水云清浅，玄妙心通显。 木人手段非凡箭，便把三乘救援。 射透个中宫殿，得见如来面。 桃源遁客问道 桃源遁客专来到，问我些儿玄妙。 说破坎离颠倒，水火同炉灶。 虎龙蟠绕成丹宝，五色祥云开导。 引出胎仙不耄，和住蓬莱岛。 五台月长老来点茶 五台月老通三要，便把三彭除剿。 运用三车皎皎，般载三乘妙。 龙华三会心明晓，顿觉三光并照。 个内三坛设醮，自己三清了。 赠蔡先生翁母攒三字 □□夫妇听裁断，□□好生舍。 □□男儿休管，□□俄然断。 □□恩爱无萦绊，□□渐令火锻。 □□明明光灿，□□山侗唤。 又 鸳鸯未老头先白，有甚因缘难测。 说破自然会得，盖为贪迷色。 人还省悟溪山蓦，物外专修道德。 清净神仙法则，得住蓬莱宅。 赠老姚先生 修行先把家缘舍，莫顺人情谈话。 慎勿攀高忽下，休着纤毫假。 心猿意马无令耍，真净真清幽雅。 神气和调惺洒，功满丹无价。 何先生欲游海岛以竹杖赠之 道家攀送呈玄趣，膝上自然琴抚。 声透九霄妙处，引下青鸾舞。 流霞满酌休辞诉，九节灵枝携去。 相助亘初行步，直上蓬莱路。 寄赵公绰殿试 今朝传出些修炼，外把万缘锻炼。 炼过更宜重炼，识破何劳炼。 才方向裹闲烹炼，六贼三尸频炼。 镜灭心忘丹炼，得得成真炼。 又颂 人在万缘锁，若是勘得破。 又更识得破，修行做得过。 寄张知观联珠 岐阳镇上丹霞观，〔观〕主张公手段。 〔段〕段丹田照管，〔管〕顾常明灿。 〔灿〕然内景真堪看，〔看〕透性无素乱。 〔乱〕道祝贤遐算，〔算〕得神仙伴。 赠古刘二先生 前程合有修仙分，竞利争名吃顿。 遏意逆情愁闷，逼得回头紧。 算来贪甚浮华境，不若完全性命。 直认无为清净，管取成仙准。 寄主簿王彦文 前程合有修仙契，分外难求名利。 所措莫能如意，激出修行志。 算来生死无人替，肯把自身家累。 要占十洲仙位，清净功夫累。 赠李四官 闲思今古回头底，是非功成名遂。 往往事无如意，猛悟寻归计。 超然拂神无家累，物外行功积累。 博得圣贤欢喜，蓬岛安排你。 赠郑先生 有心入道当回首，〔何〕况流年六九。 性命宜乎早救，莫待身枯朽。 无为清净功夫守，自是神丹无漏。
chunks.translated_text:
**The Immortal’s True Joy at Penglai**
The immortal’s true joy at Penglai—
not in vain the Penglai vow.

**Another**
Ma Feng, by chance, took up the Daoist path,
no envy for mortal wealth and rank.
He built a walled abode,
shielding from wind, frost, and rain.
By day and night, he mended the numinous light—
one day, his work complete, he shall depart.
To dwell in Penglai’s grotto-palace,
serving our Master.

**Sent to Three Daoist Friends: Tan, Liu, and Hao #2**
Tan Feng, Liu, and Hao—cloud and mist friends,
carefree, wandering at ease.
When the mood wanes, best return to Shaanxi’s west,
to speak of the *wu* within *you*.
Ever pure, ever still, ever free from leakage—
then tiger and dragon unite in embrace.
Within this, no divine yet divine splendor,
but the draught of immortality’s wine.

**On Meeting Ma Feng**
Ma Feng, once a rich man’s son—
why cast off wife and child?
Now a drifting, impoverished soul,
until he met Master Chongyang.
From then, styled "Master Danyang,"
worldly affairs vanished without trace.
Awakened to the truth of man’s birth—
he shall surely become an immortal.

**Self-Realization**
Father and elder brothers passed before their time—
no need for divination henceforth.
Surely the wheel turns to me next—
how to escape birth and death?
Awakened, I become a fleeting shadow,
let others guess and shatter their hearts.
Recognize the true *somewhat* within—
then share in the clouds’ embrace.

**Thinking of Gao of Liaoyang’s Great Talent**
*To the Tune "Remembering an Old Friend at Taoyuan"*
Since parting, I often dwell in restless longing.
Where now does his official journey lead?
He has forgotten our first meeting.
I now cultivate beyond the world—
only wishing he might awaken.
Fiercely abandon glory, wealth, and rank,
to join the cloud and mist companions.

**To the Kong Brothers of Kong Hermitage**
Four brothers, Kong—
the two youngest have passed.
No need for divination hereafter—
just recall them and shed tears.
Birth, death—how to avoid?
Best fiercely cast off worldly ties,
cultivate beyond the world, accumulate merit,
and surely attain the immortal’s rank.

**Exhorting Li the Ritual Master of the Three Altars in Chang’an**
Master Li, Keeper of the Observances, heed my counsel—
this alone is not yet the ultimate ease.
Awaken to the clarity of water and cloud,
the profound mystery of the heart made manifest.
The Wooden Man’s skill is no ordinary arrow—
use the Three Vehicles to rescue and aid.
Pierce through the palace within—
then behold the Tathāgata’s face.

**The Recluse of Taoyuan Asks of the Dao**
The recluse of Taoyuan came especially,
asking of some subtle mystery.
I spoke of the inversion of *kan* and *li*,
water and fire sharing the same furnace.
Tiger and dragon coil to form the elixir-treasure,
five-colored auspicious clouds parting the way.
They guide forth the embryonic immortal, untouched by age,
to dwell on Penglai’s isle.

**Master Wutai Yue Comes to Share Tea**
Master Wutai Yue, master of the Three Essentials,
has expelled the Three Pengs.
Wielding the Three Carts, radiant and bright,
they bear the Three Vehicles’ wonders.
The Three Assemblies at Dragon Flower—his heart now clear,
suddenly the Three Lights shine as one.
Within, the Three Altars’ rites are set—
he himself has attained the Three Purities.

**To Master Cai and His Wife (Three-Character Stanza)**
□□Husband and wife, heed my judgment:
□□Best to relinquish □□.
□□Let sons be—no need to manage,
□□for soon they shall be severed.
□□Entanglements of love, unshackled,
□□gradually refined by fire.
□□Bright, luminous, and resplendent,
□□the mountain rustic calls.

**Another**
Mandarin ducks, not yet old, but hair already white—
what karmic cause is so hard to fathom?
Speak the truth, and naturally you shall understand:
all for clinging to lust and delusion.
If one awakens and suddenly flees to rivers and mountains,
devoted to cultivating virtue beyond the world—
the pure and still Daoist dharma—
then dwell in Penglai’s abode.

**To Elder Master Yao**
First in cultivation, cast off worldly ties,
do not follow worldly chatter.
Beware of climbing high then neglecting the low,
do not cling to the slightest pretense.
Restrain the heart’s monkey and the mind’s horse,
truly still, truly pure, serene and refined.
When spirit and qi harmonize, awake and free—
merit complete, the elixir priceless.

**To Master He, Bound for the Isles, with a Bamboo Staff**
A Daoist gift, presenting the profound—
naturally, a zither rests upon the knee.
Its sound pierces the nine heavens’ mystery,
drawing the green luan to dance.
Fill the cup with flowing rosy clouds—do not refuse—
take the nine-jointed numinous branch.
It shall aid your steps from the very beginning,
straight to Penglai’s path.

**To Zhao Gongchuo Before the Palace Examination**
Today, the transmission of cultivation’s practice—
externally, refine the ten thousand entanglements.
Refined once, best refine again,
what need to refine if you’ve seen through?
Only then, within, leisurely refine—
the Six Bandits and Three Corpses, repeatedly refined.
Mirror extinguished, heart forgotten, the elixir refined—
then truly refine into reality.

**Another Chant**
Man is bound by the ten thousand entanglements—
if you can see through them,
and further recognize them,
then cultivation can be accomplished.

**To Zhang the Keeper of the Lianzhu Abbey**
At the Zhenyang Town’s Cinnabar Cloud Abbey,
Abbot Zhang’s skillful hands.
Section by section, the Cinnabar Field tended,
ever bright and resplendent.
Within, the inner landscape truly worth beholding—
seeing through nature’s rootless chaos.
The Dao blesses your long life—
may you gain immortals as companions.

**To the Two Masters Liu of Ancient Times**
Your destiny holds a share in immortal cultivation—
why vie for profit, contend for fame, and suffer a rebuke?
Restraining desire, defying emotion, sorrow and vexation—
compelled to turn back swiftly.
Counting up, what’s the use of fleeting splendor?
Better to preserve your nature and life.
Directly recognize the *wuwei* purity—
then surely attain immortality.

**To Registrar Wang Yanwen**
Your destiny holds a share in the immortal’s covenant—
beyond that, hard to seek fame and profit.
What you arrange cannot be as you wish—
this spurs the resolve to cultivate.
Counting up, no one can replace you in birth and death—
how could you burden yourself with worldly ties?
To claim the immortal’s seat on the Ten Isles—
pile up pure and still merit.

**To Officer Li the Fourth**
Leisurely reflecting on past and present, those who turn back—
their right and wrong, merits and fame achieved.
Yet often, affairs do not go as wished—
suddenly awakened, they seek a way to return.
Transcending the world, brushing aside worldly burdens,
cultivating merit beyond the world.
Winning the joy of sages and worthies—
Peng Island awaits your place.

**To Master Zheng**
If you intend to enter the Dao, first turn back—
how much more so, now in your sixty-ninth year?
Life and destiny should be saved early—
do not wait until the body withers.
Guard the *wuwei* purity and stillness—
naturally, the divine elixir shall be without leakage.

irage of Penglai appears,
tigers roar in Penglai’s gardens.
Dragons chant, coiling around Penglai’s halls,
crane chariots and Penglai’s phoenix carriages.
The elixir, revealed through Penglai’s nine revolutions,
worthy to meet Penglai’s selection.

**Another**
Kun Jian Mountain near Penglai’s outskirts,
connected to Penglai’s cloud feet.
Wondrous scenes of Penglai gleam,
rosy clouds transform Penglai’s cranes.
Golden winds blow, turning Penglai’s pavilion—
naturally, Penglai’s elixir is present.

chunks.original_text: 天地可同长久，永作云霞友。 赠亭川众道友 尘中个个贪名利，要赛石崇富贵。 争柰前程不讳，莫也难逃避。 悟来诈做飍飍地，便是脱家奇计。 炼气全神圆备，得赴蓬瀛位。 赠董先生藏头联珠 〔准〕予属付须当认，〔认〕取本源清净。 〔净〕意清心除境，〔境〕灭心忘尽o 〔尽〕形八戒持来正，〔正〕洽灵灵心印。 〔印〕结光辉禅定，〔定〕是神仙准。 赠董先生 □泉西裹云朋董，□访扶风钰洞。 □话真铅真汞，□火如何弄。 □分清净功能总，□蚁穿珠九孔。 □午倒颠成洪，□性真堪宠。 拆龙字起。 赠华事仙大师攒三字 □□仙老真禅老，□□万缘拂扫。 □□下心最妙，□□俄然了。 □□神气精三宝，□□闲烹炉灶。 □□丹成惊早，□□真如好。 赴黄箓离赠道众 寻声救苦酬予愿，海角天涯心遍。 暗诱人离火院，物外真修炼。 寻思地狱心寒颤，救拔亡灵经念。 枷锁自然脱免，总赴蓬莱宴。 会弟运甫有书议葬事以词答之 在生已是为来错，死后形骸丑恶。 合避三光寥廓； 埋了休拾掇。 子孙办孝如媒妁，迁葬分明嬉谑。 并骨共同棺椁，显露贪欢乐。 又 悟来顿觉从前错，怎敢起心生恶。 斡运蓬莱银廓，个内如抬掇。 无中婴姹凭媒妁，须用，黄婆为谑。 和会出离琼椁，天上长安乐。 天道无亲本名甘草子 劝众道友 唯显，想像庄周，梦蝶飞轻粉。 悟彻本无亲，天道一堪凭信。 一志寂寥修行紧，便莫惜，假躯娇嫩。 捐弃家缘须陡顿，作女男妻恨。 劝董公道友#3 奉劝，难裕修持，自有清清雨。 雨变雪花飞，得见青莲浦。 陪伴脱尘云霞侣，不要起，攀缘心绪。 莫恋金笼共鹦鹉，听马风真语。 传妙道本名传北枝 借柳饲韵 山侗正抚，心琴仙调。 蓦然想、道契仇香姓赵。 愿吾官，早开悟，事皆颠倒。 匿智慧，装懵懂，咄去奸俏。 便仿效、许氏庞公，全家物外，个个总了了。 又 清心净意，通禅明道。

The heavens and earth may endure forever—
ever be companions of cloud and mist.

**To the Many Daoist Friends at Tingchuan**
In the dust, each grasps for fame and profit,
vying to outshine Shi Chong’s wealth.
Yet how can one evade what fate forbids?
Even so, escape is hard.
Awakened, feigning haste—
this is the wondrous plan to leave the household.
Refine *qi*, perfect spirit in full,
then take your place on Penglai’s isles.

**To Master Dong: Linked-Pearl Couplet**
[Pre]pare to receive what must be recognized—
[recog]nize the root-source’s purity.
[Pure] intent, clear mind, expel illusions—
[illus]ions vanish, the mind forgets all.
[All] forms uphold the Eight Precepts rightly—
[right]ly aligned with the luminous mind-seal.
[Seal] fastens radiant *chan* stillness—
[still]ness is the sure path of immortals.

**To Master Dong**
□ west of the spring, cloud-companion Dong,
□ sought the Jade Cave of Fufeng.
□ spoke of true lead, true mercury—
□ how to tend the fire?
□ all pure and still merit resides—
□ ants bore through nine-holed pearls.
□ noon’s inversion forges the vast—
□ true nature is worthy of honor.

*(Breaking the character "龙" to begin.)*

**To the Great Master Hua Shi Xian**
□□ immortal elder, true *chan* elder,
□□ sweeping away ten thousand entanglements.
□□ humbling the heart is most wondrous—
□□ suddenly, all is understood.
□□ the three treasures: spirit, *qi*, essence—
□□ idly tending the furnace and hearth.
□□ the elixir’s early completion startles—
□□ true suchness is fine.

**Parting Gift to the Daoist Assembly at the Yellow Register Retreat**
Seeking sound to save the suffering, fulfilling my vow—
my heart reaches the ends of sea and sky.
Secretly guiding people from the fiery household,
truly cultivating beyond the world.
Reflecting on hell, the heart shudders—
reciting scriptures to deliver departed souls.
Shackles naturally fall away,
all ascending to Penglai’s feast.

**To My Disciple Yunfu, Who Wrote Regarding Funeral Matters: A Poetic Reply**
In life, already a mistake for what comes next—
in death, the body’s ugliness.
Best to avoid the vast expanse of the Three Lights;
bury it and leave it be.
Descendants perform filial rites like matchmakers—
exhuming and reburial are but jest.
Bones together in a shared coffin,
displaying greed for fleeting joy.

**Again**
Awakened, suddenly realizing past errors—
how dare one harbor evil thoughts?
Turning the wheel of Penglai’s silver expanse,
within, as if lifting and arranging.
From nothingness, the infant and maiden rely on a matchmaker—
indeed, the Yellow Dame’s jest.
Harmonizing, emerging from the jade coffin,
in heaven, eternal bliss.

**The Dao of Heaven Is Impartial (Originally Titled "Licorice Root")**
**Exhorting the Many Daoist Friends**
Only now, recalling Zhuang Zhou—
a butterfly’s dream, light as powder.
Thoroughly awakened to the truth of no ties,
the Dao of Heaven alone is trustworthy.
Single-mindedly, urgently cultivate in solitude—
do not cling to this borrowed, delicate frame.
Abandon household ties at once,
forsaking love and resentment between man and wife.

**Exhorting Master Dong, Daoist Friend #3**
I urge you—
though cultivation is hard to sustain,
there is the clearest of rains.
Rain turns to flying snow,
revealing the green lotus shore.
Accompanying companions who transcend the dust, cloud and mist—
do not stir the mind of clinging.
Do not love the golden cage and parrot—
hear the true words of the horse and wind.

**Transmitting the Wondrous Dao (Originally Titled "Transmitting the Northern Branch")**
**To the Tune of "Feeding the Willows"**
The mountain rustic plucks rightly,
the heart’s zither in immortal tune.
Suddenly recalling—
the Dao’s bond with the fragrant-named Zhao.
I wish for you, sir, to awaken early—
all affairs are upside-down.
Hide wisdom, feign ignorance—
away with cunning and cleverness!
Then emulate
Xu’s and Pang’s households,
wholly beyond the world,
each and every one fully enlightened.

**Again**
Pure heart, still intent,
penetrating *chan*, illuminating the Dao.

chunks.original_text: 逍遥乐、永无忧恼。 纵狂歌，任下士，闻之大笑。 笑则笑，怎知得，内貌忒好。 待异日、行满功成，管决有，紫书来到。 满庭芳 迷碁引 口幸谩人，手谈胡指，暗怀奸狡心肠。 只图自括，一任你咱亡。 得胜无声之乐，笑他家、不哭之丧。 无慈念，杀心打劫，一向骋乖张。 偶因，师点破，回心作善，入道从长。 便通玄知白，守黑离乡。 绝虑忘机养浩，炼神丹、出自重阳。 行教化，阐扬微妙，诗曲满庭芳。 叹名利#1 利惹心猿，名牵意马，无昼无夜奔驰。 波波劫劫，来往没休期。 一向贪饕越煞，心劳役、形苦神疲。 休迷执，一个口裹，插得几张匙。 堪嗟，虚幻事，妻男走骨，自己行尸。 又何须相爱，相恋相随。 好把轮回趖躲，早参禅、访道寻师。 长生话，有些微妙，端的上天梯。 出樊笼赠京兆刘法司 掣断名缰，敲开利锁，忻然跃出樊笼。 无拘无管，纵步任西东。 自在逍遥活计，占无为、清净家风。 无情念，亦无僧爱，到处且和同。 不唯，身坦荡，心中豁畅，性上玲珑。 更不搜婴姹，坎虎离龙。 方寸澄清湛寂，得自然、神气和冲。 神仙事，何愁不了，决定赴蓬宫。 重遇吟 重遇风仙，重增开悟，一心专做痴愚。 掀髯势已，且恁觜卢都。 罢了高谈阔论，疏笔砚、不讲经书。 从今后，孤云野鹤，鷇食更鹑裾。 寒来，求纸布，忻来歌舞，饥觅残余。 似孤舟不系，有甚程途。 自在逍遥坦荡，更无着、无染无拘。 人来问，看予活计，何必更询予。 赠赵先生母蓬瀛散人 京兆城中，章台街裹，有个豪富杨姑。 道庵创置，与子不尘居。 燕处逍遥快乐，戴云包、酷好清虚。 阴德积，怜贫爱老，设狱祭魂孤。 环墙，修十座，衣准独赡，三处安厨。 寿长年出自，道力相扶。 腊月下旬有二，与真人、降诞无殊。 功行累，将来定是，跨鹤赴仙都。 觉觉觉 道法弥高，教门洪大，东西南北无边。 阐开玄径，剔正路无偏。 行步逍遥坦荡，尘情事、不许萦牵。 明三觉，精神气涌，清净递相传。 自然，成造化，木金间隔，水火潺湲。 定虎龙交媾，婴姹牢坚。 结正金丹大药，银霞内、灿烂光圆。 飞腾势，往来出入，逗引大罗仙。 离苦海赠张二官 人喜生儿，谁知替你，被他夺了精神。 系伊心意，唯恐不成人。 养大留心何处，惜妻男、忘了伊恩。 休惆怅，闻身强健，别觅个良因。 怡然，离苦海，断情割爱，绝虑忘尘。 访云朋霞友，月伴风邻。 讲论长生久视，通玄妙、固蒂深根。 金丹结，功成行满，跨鹤去朝真。 论金玉 玉洞玄玄，金炉灿灿，清中金玉希奇。 金龙玉虎，玉走与金飞。 撞透金门玉户，见金莲、玉蕊争辉。 金玉好，天风摇曳，玉叶与金枝。 锜锜，金与玉，金婴玉姹，玉步金闱。 显金光玉艳，玉貌金衣。 此个灵金灵玉，结金丹、玉性无亏。 真金玉，钰成玄宝，出自本师知。 处自然 清净真功，无为大道，自然体用惺憁。 先天灵物，元本在吾胸。 南北东西相会，慧眸开、论甚蒙眬。 壶中景，水生玉虎，火内长金龙。 祥光，敷宇宙，三田丹秀，八脉神通。 且披蓑顶笠，有似渔翁。 阐出玄玄妙趣，劝人人、气养和冲。 同修炼，功成行满，相逐赴仙宫。 冰雪亭题晏子礼 瑞霭浮浮，祥氛冉冉，卷帘缟夜幽光。 清奇峻洁，有类布浓霜。 恰似山侗内景，琼花绽、玉蕊芬芳。
chunks.translated_text:
**To the Tune of "Carefree Joy"**
Carefree joy—forever without sorrow or vexation.
Sing wildly if you will,
let the petty men below hear and laugh aloud.
Let them laugh—
how would they know
the inner beauty is too fine?
Wait for the day when merit is complete and the work fulfilled—
then surely the purple writ will arrive.

**To the Tune of "Filling the Courtyard with Fragrance"**
*Deluded Chess*
Words slip glibly from the mouth,
hands point recklessly at the board,
while dark hearts harbor cunning and deceit.
Only scheming for self-gain,
letting others perish as they may.
The silent joy of victory—
laughing at those who mourn without tears.
No compassion,
a murderous heart plundering,
ever bent on perversity.

By chance,
a master’s awakening touch—
turn the heart to goodness,
enter the Dao and follow it long.
Then penetrate mystery, know the white,
guard the black, leave the homeland.
Cut off thought, forget cunning, nurture vastness,
refine the elixir of spirit—
born of Chongyang’s lineage.
Go forth to teach and transform,
expound the subtle and wondrous—
poems and songs fill the courtyard with fragrance.

**Lamenting Fame and Profit**
Profit lures the mind-monkey,
fame tugs the intent-horse,
rushing day and night without cease.
Wave after wave, kalpa after kalpa,
coming and going without end.
Ever gluttonous, ever ravenous,
the heart toils, the body suffers, the spirit wearies.
Cease this delusion—
in a single mouth,
how many spoons can you fit?

Pitiable,
these illusory affairs:
wife and sons, mere walking bones,
oneself a moving corpse.
Why cling to love,
to attachment, to following?
Best to evade the wheel of rebirth,
early seek *chan*, visit the Dao, find a master.
The discourse of long life—
there is subtle wonder in it,
truly the ladder to heaven.

**Breaking Free from the Cage: A Gift to Magistrate Liu of Jingzhao**
Snap the reins of fame,
strike open the lock of profit,
joyfully leap from the cage.
Unfettered, unbound,
stroll east or west as you please.
A life of carefree ease,
embracing non-action,
the pure and still family way.
No clinging thoughts,
no love for the monastic—
wherever you go, harmony prevails.

Not only
is the body at ease,
the heart vast and open,
the nature clear and bright.
No need to seek the infant and maiden,
the Kan tiger or Li dragon.
The square inch of the mind—
stilled, limpid, profoundly serene,
attaining the natural harmony of spirit and qi.
The affairs of immortals—
what cause for doubt?
You will surely ascend to Peng Palace.

**Chant of Reunion**
Reuniting with the wind immortal,
deeper awakening,
the heart wholly given to feigned foolishness.
The beard bristles with vigor,
yet the mouth stays shut, silent.
Done with lofty discourse and grand debates,
the brush and inkstone set aside,
no more expounding of scriptures.
From now on,
a solitary cloud, a wild crane,
feeding like a fledgling, clad in tattered robes.

When cold comes,
seek paper and cloth;
when joy arrives,
sing and dance.
Hungry, scavenge scraps—
like an untethered boat,
what course or destination?
Carefree, at ease, unburdened,
no attachments, no stains, no constraints.
If someone asks,
look to my way of life—
why question me further?

**To Madame Zhao, the Pengying Immortal**
In the city of Jingzhao,
on Zhangtai Street,
lived the wealthy Madame Yang.
She built a Daoist abode,
a home for her son, free from worldly dust.
Living in carefree joy,
she wore clouds like a cloak,
passionately fond of purity and emptiness.
Her hidden virtue accumulated—
pitying the poor, loving the aged,
setting up prisons and offering sacrifices for the lonely dead.

Around the walls,
ten halls were built,
clothing and food provided alone,
kitchens set up in three places.
Her long life and years
were sustained by the power of the Dao.
On the twenty-second day of the twelfth lunar month,
she was born no different from an immortal.
With merit and conduct piled high,
she will surely one day
mount a crane and ascend to the immortal capital.

**Awakening, Awakening, Awakening**
The Dao’s law grows ever loftier,
the teachings vast and boundless,
stretching east, west, south, and north without limit.
Opening the mysterious path,
clearing the straight road without bias.
Walking in carefree ease,
worldly affairs must not entangle.
Illuminating the three awakenings,
spirit and qi surge,
pure and still, transmitted in succession.

Naturally,
creation is accomplished—
wood and metal separated,
water and fire flowing.
The tiger and dragon unite,
the infant and maiden steadfast.
The great medicine of the true golden elixir forms,
within silver clouds,
radiant and resplendent.
The momentum of ascent—
coming and going, entering and exiting,
beckoning the immortals of the Great Canopy.

**Escaping the Sea of Suffering: A Gift to Official Zhang the Second**
People rejoice at the birth of a son,
who knows he will steal your spirit?
Bound to his heart and will,
fearing he won’t grow to manhood.
When he’s raised, where does your care go?
Cherishing wife and sons,
forgetting his kindness.
Do not grieve—
while the body is strong and healthy,
seek another good cause.

Joyfully,
escape the sea of suffering,
cut off love, sever attachment,
forget thoughts, abandon dust.
Visit cloud companions and mist friends,
moonlit neighbors and windy kin.
Discuss the long life of enduring vision,
penetrate the wondrous mystery,
root deeply and firmly.
The golden elixir forms,
merit complete, conduct fulfilled—
mount a crane and go to pay homage to the true.

**On Gold and Jade**
The jade cave, profound and dark,
the golden furnace, radiant and bright—
within purity, gold and jade are rare.
The golden dragon, the jade tiger,
jade runs, gold flies.
Crashing through the golden gate and jade door,
golden lotuses and jade buds vie in splendor.
How fine are gold and jade—
heavenly winds sway them,
jade leaves and golden branches.

Clinking,
gold and jade—
the golden infant, the jade maiden,
jade steps, the golden chamber.
Revealing golden light and jade brilliance,
jade countenance and golden robes.
This numinous gold, this numinous jade,
forming the golden elixir,
the jade nature unharmed.
True gold and jade,
refined into the mysterious treasure—
known only to the original master.

**Abiding in the Natural**
Pure and still true work,
the great Dao of non-action—
naturally, the body and function awaken.
The numinous essence of prior heaven,
originally within my breast.
North, south, east, west meet,
the eye of wisdom opens—
what need for dimness or blur?
Within the gourd’s scene,
water births the jade tiger,
fire nurtures the golden dragon.

Auspicious light
spreads through the universe—
the three fields bloom with elixir,
the eight vessels divine and free.
Donning straw cloak and bamboo hat,
like a fisherman.
Expounding the profound and wondrous delight,
urging all to nurture harmonious qi.
Together we cultivate,
merit complete, conduct fulfilled—
following one another to the immortal palace.

**Inscribed at the Pavilion of Ice and Snow: For Yanzi’s Rites**
Auspicious mist floats,
propitious vapors rise gently—
parting the curtain, the white night’s subtle glow.
Pure, lofty, and pristine,
like a thick layer of frost.
Just like the inner vision of the mountain rustic—
jade flowers bloom,
jade buds exude fragrance.

**To the Tune of "Feeding the Willows"**
The mountain rustic plucks rightly,
the heart’s zither in immortal tune.
Suddenly recalling—
the Dao’s bond with the fragrant-named Zhao.
I wish for you, sir, to awaken early—
all affairs are upside-down.
Hide wisdom, feign ignorance—
away with cunning and cleverness!
Then emulate
Xu’s and Pang’s households,
wholly beyond the world,
each and every one fully enlightened.

**Again**
Pure heart, still intent,
penetrating *chan*, illuminating the Dao.

chunks.original_text: 瑶瑛结，连城宝气，璀璨射珪璋。 何须，沉与麝，自然馥郁，不比寻常。 见银蟾吐耀，斡运圆方。 姑射真人放浪，弄风行、玉佩玎珰。 胎仙现，白云深处，恣意饮琼浆。 赴莱州黄箓大醮作 口口相传，真真相济，悟来意解心通。 玄中妙趣，明月应清风。 师祖锺离传吕，吕公得、传授王公。 王公了，秘传马钰，真行助真功。 彭城，并道友，邀予追荐，数次途中。 更同知节使，节副相容。 跪领尊官台旨，加持在、紫极之宫。 亡灵福，超升天界，了了道深崇。 刀圭法 日月交宫，虎龙共处，不分南北东西。 五方秀气，攒聚结刀圭。 十二时中鍜炼，尖锋上、进出光辉。 堪安把，住行坐卧，恣意倒颠携。 添钢，增刃快，断除六贼，消灭三尸。 便往来挥动，剖判昏迷。 谁信无中妙用，变成个、惺洒婴儿。 修真理，因师传授，转付友人知。 和张飞卿殿试韵 七赴皇都，三经殿试，怎知炼气绵绵。 心猿休歇，意马罢强颠。 燕处申申快意，仗清净、固住灵源。 玄玄处，三光并秀，照耀洞中天。 劝君，开觉悟，休驰才俊，听取余言。 有逍遥妙路，无说无传。 决烈一刀两段，绝缘虑、自是通玄。 真功就，留侯的裔，继踵作神仙。 赞重阳真人显异 悯化真人，重阳师父，头头物物皆通。 归期预指，语话似心风。 果应南京行上，升霞后、教训臧公。 师父重阳真人当日升霞，至暮时分，臧公在南京遇之，尚不知升霞，犹以为生，后方知之。 其速有如此者。 岐阳镇，顶，冠下界，为我再传功。
chunks.translated_text:
Jade essences coalesce,
their treasured radiance outshining jade tablets—
linked as a city’s rarest gem.
Why seek musk or amber?
Naturally fragrant and rich,
beyond the common.
Behold the silver toad spilling brilliance,
turning the square and round in its course.
The Perfected One of Guye roams freely,
playing with the wind, jade pendants chiming.
The fetal immortal appears
deep in the white clouds,
drinking celestial nectar at will.

*Composed for the Grand Offering at Laizhou’s Yellow Register*

Oral transmission passes on,
truths mutually sustaining,
awakening to a mind in harmony.
Within the profound, wondrous delight—
the bright moon answers the clear wind.
Master Ancestor Zhongli transmitted to Lü,
Lü transmitted to Lord Wang,
Lord Wang perfected it,
secretly passing it to Ma Yu,
true conduct aiding true attainment.

In Pengcheng, with fellow Daoists,
I was invited to perform rites of deliverance,
several times along the journey.
Together with the Military Commissioner
and his deputy, we were received.
Kneeling to receive the honored official’s decree,
the empowerment bestowed in the Purple Ultimate Palace.
The departed soul’s blessing—
ascending to the celestial realm,
profound and lofty the Dao.

**The Knife-Point Method**
Sun and moon conjoin in the palace,
tiger and dragon dwell as one,
no division of south or north, east or west.
The quintessence of the five directions
gathers and coalesces into the knife-point.
Within the twelve hours, refine it—
at the sharp tip, light streams forth.
Worthy to grasp,
in walking, standing, sitting, lying,
freely wielding it upside-down.

Add steel, sharpen the blade,
sever the six thieves,
dispel the three corpses.
Then, brandishing it to and fro,
cleave through delusion.
Who would believe the wondrous use within nothingness?
Transforming into a wakeful, carefree infant.
The principle of cultivating truth—
transmitted by the master,
passed on to fellow practitioners.

**Matching Rhymes with Zhang Feiqing’s Palace Examination Verse**
Seven times to the imperial capital,
thrice through the palace examination—
how could one know the ceaseless refinement of qi?
The heart-monkey rests,
the mind-horse ceases its wild leaps.
In joyful ease like the swallows,
relying on purity to secure the spirit’s source.
In the profoundest realm,
the three luminaries shine together,
illuminating the cavern-heaven.

I urge you, awaken—
cease chasing talent and brilliance,
hear my words.
There is a wondrous path of freedom,
beyond words, beyond transmission.
With resolute decisiveness, a single blade cuts two—
severing entanglements, naturally penetrating the profound.
True attainment achieved,
the descendants of the Marquis of Liu
follow in succession to become immortals.

**In Praise of Perfected Lord Chongyang’s Manifestations**
The compassionate Perfected One,
Master Chongyang,
pervades all things with understanding.
His return date foretold,
his words like the wind of the heart.
As predicted, he journeyed to Nanjing,
ascending in rosy clouds—
instructing Master Zang afterward.
When Master Chongyang ascended in rosy clouds,
by dusk, Master Zang in Nanjing encountered him,
still unaware of his ascension, thinking him alive.
Only later did he realize—
so swift was it.

In Qiyang Town,
his crown towering above the mortal realm,
he transmitted his teachings to me once more.

chunks.original_text: 华亭，城西现，救予疾苦，气布身中。 在文登云上，显出慈容。 县宰尼厉虎见，经顷刻，复返天宫。 真实事，古今希罕，自是足人崇。 退姜四翁所惠团袄 一纪环墙，数年赤脚，啀他寒冷如囚。 超然一志，决要行功周。 感得神仙下界，向身中、布气如流。 无凝滞，冲和上下，相应好因由。 关西，牒发我，远来东土，恣意贪求。 做天来大错，敢受绵裘。 结裹身如图囤，招谴责、厥疾难廖。 还团袄，潇潇洒洒，褴褛显真修。 叹慈汉 镜内苍颜，梳间白发，犹然骋俊刚求。 不愁自己，贪为子孙忧。 日日争名竞利，时时地、筹运机谋。 堪失笑，这般憨汉，直待死方休。 人还，依我劝，无常事紧，性命堪搜。 愿诸公惺洒，慷慨回头。 莫说蓬莱路远，心开悟、咫尺瀛洲。 真清净，无为功满，得去列仙俦。 心自笑 学道修仙，累功积行，常愁行少功亏。 劝人作善，於道最相宜。 稍稍缘行端正，早傍人、别意猜疑。 心自笑，图他功行，怎避是和非。 华山，陈处士，不侵耕织，山下行稀。 尚有人相毁，发叹吟诗。 清正无私无曲，任前程、宠辱灾危。 随缘过，腾腾兀兀，歌舞乐希夷。 黄县金玉庵 东寺西城，南山北海，心中好结良因。 庵名金玉，堂建号全真。 廊舍清风明月，园无漏、不落沉沦。 门清净，云朋霞友，燕处得申申。 无为，环堵裹，小松疏竹，初种新新。 向宝花台上，异事惊人。 眺望蓬莱山岛，又何必、别觅长春。 堪图画，芝川一境，马钰略铺陈。 证仙果 牝锁玄通，龙奔虎走，微微调息绵绵。 清风透户，不放马猿颠。 姹女婴儿相遇，论清净、至妙根源。 无作做，自然成道，决上大罗天。 愚男，专恳告，十方父母，听取儿言。 愿茶坊酒肆，递互相传。 莫以狐言貉语，是端的、秘密幽玄。 凭斯用，人人有分，个个做神仙。 赠君唐括氏儿舍子出家以词赠之 冒雪行车，迎风访道，投余特地参同。 说些修养，不论虎和龙。 讲甚婴儿姹女，无龟蛇、日月交宫。 无水火，亦无嗽咽，更没按时功。 的端，真妙用，无为活计，清净家风。 锁心猿意马，勿纵狂踪。 炼息绵绵来往，自然得、子母和同。 全性命，紫书来诏，直赴大罗宫。 不看谒 不谒公侯，不疎贫贱，不求富贵荣华。

In Huating, west of the city,
he appeared to save me from suffering,
his qi spreading through my body.
Atop the clouds of Wendeng,
his compassionate visage manifested.
The county magistrate, Ni Lihu, saw him—
in but a moment, he returned to the heavenly palace.
A true event, rare in ancient and modern times,
naturally worthy of reverence.

**The Padded Jacket Bestowed by the Four Elders of Tui Jiang**
A full cycle round the walls,
for years barefoot, snarling at the cold like a prisoner.
Yet with transcendent resolve,
I vowed to complete the work of cultivation.
Moved, immortals descended to the mortal realm,
pouring qi into my body like a flowing stream.
Unobstructed, harmonious above and below,
a fine cause and effect in perfect accord.

In Guanzhong, my credentials dispatched,
I journeyed far to the eastern lands,
indulging in reckless desires.
Committing errors as vast as the heavens,
how dared I accept fine robes?
Wrapping myself like a grain silo,
I invited blame and reproach—
my illness could not be cured.
Returning the padded jacket,
carefree and unburdened,
in tattered robes I displayed true cultivation.

**Lament for the Benevolent Fool**
In the mirror, a face grown sallow,
amidst the comb, hair turned white—
still he gallops in pursuit of talent and ambition.
Unconcerned for himself,
he frets for his children and grandchildren.
Day by day, vying for fame and profit,
hour by hour, scheming and plotting.
How laughable—
such a foolish man,
who will not cease until death.

People, heed my counsel:
the urgency of impermanence,
the fragility of life.
I urge you all to awaken,
to turn back with generosity.
Do not say Penglai’s path is distant—
with an enlightened heart,
the immortal isles lie but a footstep away.
Truly pure and still,
with virtue complete in non-action,
you shall join the ranks of immortals.

**A Smile in the Heart**
I laugh at myself—
pursuing the Dao, cultivating immortality,
accumulating merit and conduct,
ever fearful of falling short.
Exhorting others to do good
is most fitting for the Way.
Yet even slight uprightness
soon invites suspicion and doubt.
I laugh in my heart—
seeking merit in others,
how can one avoid right and wrong?

**On Hermit Chen of Mount Hua**
Hermit Chen of Mount Hua,
neither plowing nor weaving,
seldom descending the mountain.
Yet some still slander him,
sighing as they compose poems.
Upright, selfless, and without deceit,
he endures honor and disgrace, fortune and peril.
Living freely,
carefree and unconstrained,
he sings and dances in joyous tranquility.

**Golden Jade Hermitage of Huang County**
East of the temple, west of the city,
south of the mountains, north of the sea—
a heart that forms good affinities.
The hermitage named Golden Jade,
the hall built as the Hall of Complete Perfection.
In the corridors, the clear wind and bright moon;
in the garden, no leaks—
no fall into the depths of suffering.
At the gate, purity and stillness,
cloud companions and rosy friends,
dwelling in contentment and ease.

In non-action, within the walled enclosure,
slender pines and sparse bamboo,
newly planted and fresh.
Atop the precious flower terrace,
wondrous events astonish.
Gazing toward the islands of Penglai,
why seek elsewhere for eternal spring?
Worthy of painting—
a realm of magic mushrooms,
Ma Yu briefly unfolds.

**Attaining the Fruit of Immortality**
The mysterious pass of the feminine locked,
dragons racing, tigers running,
gently regulating the breath in unbroken continuity.
The clear wind enters through the door,
restraining the madness of horses and monkeys.
The maiden and infant meet,
discussing purity and stillness—
the most wondrous root of the source.
Without contrivance,
naturally attaining the Dao,
ascending to the Great Heaven of Tai Luo.

**Foolish Son, Earnestly I Entreat**
Parents of the ten directions,
hear your child’s words.
May the tea houses and taverns
pass these words along in turn.
Do not dismiss them as fox speech or badger words—
they are true, secret, and profound.
Rely on this practice,
and each person has a share,
each may become an immortal.

**To Lord Tangkuo’s Son Who Left Home**
Braving snow to ride the carriage,
facing the wind to seek the Dao,
you came especially to inquire of me.
Speaking of cultivation and nurturing,
no mention of tigers or dragons.
What need to discuss the infant and maiden,
the union of tortoise and snake,
the palaces of sun and moon?
No water or fire,
no swallowing or gargling,
no timed practices.

Truly, the wondrous function—
a livelihood of non-action,
a family tradition of purity and stillness.
Tame the monkey of the mind and the horse of intention,
do not let them run wild.
Refine the breath in unbroken continuity,
naturally achieving harmony between mother and child.
Preserving life and nature,
a purple summons arrives—
straight to the Great Heavenly Palace of Tai Luo.

**On Not Paying Visits**
I do not visit lords and nobles,
nor do I shun the poor and lowly,
nor seek wealth, honor, or glory.

ervades all things with understanding.
His return date foretold,
his words like the wind of the heart.
As predicted, he journeyed to Nanjing,
ascending in rosy clouds—
instructing Master Zang afterward.
When Master Chongyang ascended in rosy clouds,
by dusk, Master Zang in Nanjing encountered him,
still unaware of his ascension, thinking him alive.
Only later did he realize—
so swift was it.

In Qiyang Town,
his crown towering above the mortal realm,
he transmitted his teachings to me once more.

chunks.original_text: 不准美膳，不敢厌衣麻。 不发无明火烛，不、着境、亦不思家。 般般不，不忘师旨，炉炼白朱砂。 逍遥，真自在，清闲活计，云水生涯。 对风邻月伴，满泛流霞。 悟彻长生久视，又何必、驰骋矜夸。 将来去，祥云瑞霭，步步衬莲花。 夜叉婆 扑粉施朱，画眉补鬓，巧言令色柔和。 暗藏机狡，名唤夜叉婆。 面善心乖性恶，纤纤指、鹰爪无过。 夸体段，取人性命，入夜骋偻罗。 遇师，方省觉，要逃业障，须避冤魔，纵水云游历，远离巢窝。 急急完全神气，累功行、岂敢蹉跎。 酬心愿，劝人修炼，功到洞仙歌。 觉前非 不待人询，须当自问，如何用意图财。 若非奸狡，无有自然来。 心起悭贪嫉妬，咛思想、横祸非灾。 欺天地，暗怀狠毒，怎不落深崖。 阴司，悬业镜，难谩难谑，难闪难推。 却不如闻早，省悟心灰。 物外追陪霞友，论长生、脱兔轮回。 修功行，不忘初志，定是赴蓬莱。 怀修炼 物物心休，般般事已，进人退己从长。 无争上士，柔弱胜刚强。 垣荡逍遥度日，处清净、成就圆方。 怀修炼，亘初灵物，决要鼎中藏。 难忘，唯是道，如饥思饭，如渴思浆。 似婴儿寻母，专一思量。 急救自家性命，调真息、不要忙忙。 常细细，绵绵来往，功到赴蓬庄。 悟生死 七十韶华，暂时光景，寻思一向沉吟。 酸辛入鼻，苦痛事攒心。 生死都来两字，既生身、有死相临。 堪养气，要逃生死，物外去搜寻。 心开，通妙用，火中养木，水裹生金。 把乾坤骨髓，收向朱林。 龙虎变成婴姹，灵灵显、岂论阳阴。 无生灭，真真了了，跨鹤上瑶岑。 傀儡论 养赡浑家，贪求活路，身如傀儡当场。 被他名利，把戏引来忙。 牵惹千头万绪，使作得、举指猖狂。 夸体段，摇头弄影，驰骋好容光。 遇师，亲说破，行尸模样，走骨趋跄。 气悬丝相似，莫有无常。 急认壶中云水，叩玄关、麻麦馨香。 龙蟠虎，汞铅烹炼，丹结做蓬郎。 自破坐 执法行功，按时打坐，柰何不得惺偬。 睡魔返倒，头点点占胸。 鼻气如雷响喨，才惊觉、眼又蒙眬。 予自劝，恁般修进，怎炼虎和龙。 斯言，如不信，偷观同辈，定是心通。 见摇船身分，自愧梢翁。 好认无为大道，心清净、神气和冲。 灵光结，三丹踊跃，晃郎五明宫。 降心魔 熟境缠绵，心魔返倒，下功决要降心。 住行坐卧，昼夜志防心。 方寸虽然不大，起尘情、万种牵心。 当识破，上天入地，好弱总由心。 从今，生觉悟，牢擒意马，紧锁猿心。 把凡心裂另，要见真心。 日日澄心遣欲，更时时、校勘身心。 无私曲，自言心正，方可合天心。 骷髅样 样子骷髅，偏能贩骨，业缘去去来来。 骋驰伶俐，不肯暂心灰。 转换无休无歇，腾今古、更易形骸。 空贪寿，饶经万劫，终久打轮回。 遇师，亲指教，创修一点，免落千崖。 屏七情六欲，保护三台。 玉虎金龙并凑，青莲内、捧出婴孩。 无生灭，大罗天上，仙位得安排。 忍忍忍 刃下挑心，心头插刃，认来堪作良因。 无明降住，有辱不生嗔。 忆昔清河公艺，尚垂涕、书此和亲。 无争士，常行大善，不敢暂伤神。 人猜，泥捏塑，逢刀坦坦，遇药申申。 便是非不辩，强弱无论。 师父重阳教我，消烟火、悟假修真。 常忍耐，触来勿竞，端的做仙人。 得真乐 落魄闲人，逍遥懒汉，的端酷厌荣华。
chunks.translated_text:
No fine delicacies prepared,
nor dare I scorn hempen robes.
No flames of ignorance kindled,
no clinging to circumstances,
nor thoughts of home.
All things set aside—
only the master’s decree not forgotten,
the furnace refining cinnabar to white.

At ease, truly free,
a livelihood of leisure,
a life of clouds and water.
Facing the wind as neighbor, the moon as companion,
brimming with flowing rosy clouds.
Having awakened to long life and enduring vision,
why boast or vie for glory?
In coming and going,
auspicious clouds and瑞 mist
step by step pave the path with lotus.

**The Yaksha Hag**
Powdered face, rouged lips,
penciled brows, patched temples,
sweet words and gentle demeanor.
Cunning hidden within,
she is called the Yaksha Hag.
Beneath a kind face, a treacherous heart,
her slender fingers sharper than eagle’s talons.
Proud of her form,
she steals lives,
by night prowling the web of desire.

When meeting a master,
one awakens at last—
to flee karmic hindrances,
one must shun vengeful demons.
Though wandering waters and clouds,
keep far from her lair.
Hasten to preserve spirit and qi,
accumulate merit and practice—
dare not idle away.
Fulfill the heart’s vow,
urge others to cultivate,
and when merit is complete,
sing the hymn of the Cave Immortal.

**Awakening to Past Errors**
No need for others to inquire—
one must ask oneself:
why scheme for wealth?
Without deceit or guile,
nothing comes naturally.
When the heart stirs with stinginess, greed, or envy,
beware—calamity follows not as disaster but as retribution.
Deceiving heaven and earth,
harboring venom in secret—
how can one not plunge into the abyss?

In the netherworld,
the Mirror of Karma hangs—
no deceit, no jest,
no evasion, no denial.
Better to heed early warnings,
awaken, and let the heart turn to ash.
Beyond the mundane,
keep company with cloud companions,
discussing long life
and escaping the rabbit’s wheel of rebirth.
Cultivate merit and practice,
never forgetting the original vow—
surely one will ascend to Penglai.

**Cherishing Cultivation**
In every matter, rest the heart,
in all affairs, yield to others,
advancing or retreating as needed.
The uncontentious superior person—
softness overcomes hardness.
Wandering carefree through days,
abiding in purity,
achieving perfection in the square and round.
Cherishing cultivation,
the primordial numinous essence
must be concealed within the crucible.

**Unforgetting**
Only the Dao is unforgotten—
as hunger craves rice,
as thirst longs for drink,
like an infant seeking its mother,
single-minded in thought.
Hasten to save one’s own nature,
regulate the true breath—
do not rush.
Ever subtly,
in unbroken continuity,
when merit is complete,
ascend to Pengzhuang.

**Awakening to Life and Death**
Seventy years of fleeting splendor,
a moment’s passing scene—
pondering, one sighs.
Sour bitterness stings the nose,
painful matters crowd the heart.
Life and death—
but two words,
yet since birth,
death’s shadow looms.
To nurture qi,
one must escape life and death,
seeking beyond the mundane.

When the heart opens,
the wondrous function flows—
wood nurtured in fire,
gold born in water.
Gathering the marrow of heaven and earth,
draw it into the cinnabar forest.
Dragon and tiger transform into infant and maiden,
the numinous manifests—
what need to speak of yin and yang?
No birth, no extinction,
truly, clearly,
riding a crane to the jade peak.

**The Puppet’s Lesson**
Providing for the whole household,
greedily seeking livelihood,
the body like a puppet on stage.
Bound by fame and profit,
drawn into the play’s frenzy.
Entangled in a thousand threads,
made to act wildly with a flick of the finger.
Proud of its form,
shaking its head, mimicking shadows,
dashing about to display its beauty.

When meeting a master,
the truth is revealed—
a walking corpse,
a stumbling skeleton.
Like a marionette on strings,
awaiting impermanence.
Hasten to recognize the clouds and waters within the pot,
knock at the mysterious pass,
where fragrant hemp and wheat await.
Dragon coiled, tiger crouched,
mercury and lead refined—
the elixir congeals,
becoming a Penglang immortal.

**Breaking the Meditative Trance**
Enforcing discipline, practicing merit,
sitting by the clock—
yet why remain dull and sluggish?
The sleep demon overturns,
head nodding to the chest.
Snores like thunder,
startled awake—
eyes again grow heavy.
I admonish myself:
with such progress,
how refine tiger and dragon?

**If Unconvinced**
Observe your peers in secret—
surely their hearts are open.
Seeing them sway like boats,
ashamed, one becomes the helmsman.
Better to recognize the great Dao of non-action,
heart pure,
spirit and qi harmonized.
The numinous light congeals,
the Three Elixirs leap forth,
illuminating the Five Brightness Palace.

**Subduing the Heart-Demon**
Familiar realms entangle,
the heart-demon overturns—
in practice, one must subdue the heart.
Whether still or moving,
day and night,
guard the heart’s resolve.
Though the square inch is small,
worldly passions arise—
ten thousand kinds entangle the heart.
See through it:
whether ascending to heaven or descending to earth,
all weakness stems from the heart.

From now on,
awaken—
firmly seize the horse of intention,
tightly lock the monkey of the mind.
Shatter the ordinary heart,
to glimpse the true heart.
Day by day, clarify the heart and dispel desires,
ever and always,
examine body and mind.
Without partiality,
when the heart is upright,
only then does it align with heaven’s heart.

**The Skeleton’s Guise**
A skeleton’s form,
yet still trafficking in bones,
karmic ties coming and going.
Dashing about cleverly,
unwilling to pause, to let the heart turn to ash.
Endlessly shifting,
leaping through past and present,
changing shapes.
Vainly craving longevity,
though enduring ten thousand kalpas,
still bound to the wheel of rebirth.

When meeting a master,
receiving direct instruction—
cultivate a single point,
avoid falling into a thousand abysses.
Cast aside the seven emotions and six desires,
protect the Three Terraces.
Jade tiger and golden dragon converge,
within the blue lotus,
the infant is cradled.
No birth, no extinction—
in the Great Luo Heaven,
an immortal’s seat is prepared.

**Endure, Endure, Endure**
A blade pierces the heart,
a blade thrust into the heart—
recognize this as a good cause.
Subdue ignorance,
bear humiliation without anger.
Recalling Qinghe’s Duke Yi,
who wept as he wrote to reconcile kin—
the uncontentious person,
ever practicing great kindness,
dares not harm the spirit even briefly.

**When Others Suspect**
Like clay molded into form—
facing the knife, remain steadfast;
encountering medicine, stretch forth.
No need to argue right or wrong,
no need to weigh strength or weakness.
Master Chongyang taught me:
dispel the smoke and fire,
awaken from the false to cultivate the real.
Ever endure,
when provoked, do not contend—
truly become an immortal.

**Attaining True Joy**
A carefree wanderer,
a leisurely idler,
truly loathing glory and splendor.

chunks.original_text: 怕耽火院，不会养浑家。 万种尘缘拂尽，仗心闲、炉养丹砂。 松峰下，水边石畔，遣兴饮流霞。 一灵，常皎洁，优游恬淡，真乐无涯。 论比之明月，月有云遮。 若比孤云自在，风飘荡、牢落堪嗟。 予亲遇，得超彼岸，快活更无加 和芝阳灵元子卫信道韵 放懒生涯，欣慵活计，起心念念慈悲。 而今不肯，摘叶更寻枝。 撇下之乎者也，的端认、莲出青泥。 闲闲裹，扪心自忖，有似遇良医。 逍遥，真自在，要成仙福，凭仗心师。 志坚如山岳，不许胡移。 日用无为清净，自然得、捉住东西。 些玄妙，悟来通晓，虽老不为迟。 复用前韵 吊孝之人，送终之辈，当思兔死狐悲。 青春渐老，休要恋花枝。 好把精神收拾，超彼岸、出水腾泥。 皈正觉，自心有病，物外去寻医。 良医，无药饵，劈昏凿暗，便是明师。 要心无染着，熟境迁移。 神净虎龙交媾，任红日、东出还西。 无忧恼，长安路上，行道不迟迟。 离众生示门人 尽说烟消，皆言火灭，触来总起无明。 不知不觉，怎得离众生。 道本易行易晓，柰心违、难晓难行。 心魔障，未成大善，方寸不能灵。 同流，听嘱付，是非休辩，人我休争。 叹行尸走骨，何辱何荣。 急救自家性命，气神和、清结真形。 灵灵语，瑶台阆苑，蓬岛是前程。 混元刘法师升化以词赞之 幼则随群，长而异众，一心法箓行持。 书符咒水，治病救灾危。 建德如偷不显，厌华丽、蛎食粗衣。 亲曾遇，重阳师父，传授入希夷。 自知，功行满，速来访我，径就归期。 便怡然拂袖，应限宜时。 此者彭城了了，马风风、当赋新词。 长生得，携云仙去，跨鹤赴瑶池。 赞重阳真人出现 古郡登州，望仙门外，画桥车马难通。 重阳师父，对众显家风。 预说逢何必坏，经一纪、太守何公。 嫌崄峻，令人拆毁，命匠别兴功。 文登，重出现，白龟莲上，端坐空中。 宰公尼厖虎，得遇真容。 忽见回身侧卧，祥云动、复往仙宫。 人争画，家家供养，处处总钦崇。 又 妙行真人，重阳师父，遇师吕祖玄通。 十年了道，归去得乘风。 一纪三番下界，性正直、凡事依公。 天上现，无为手段，超显自然功。 全真，文集裹，藏机隐密，妙在其中。 论龙吟虎啸，婴姹娇容。 玉内金光灿灿，神丹结、跃出灵宫。 人还悟，速修清净，休受世间崇。 赠辛五翁姜四翁 豪富过人，作为异众，莱阳姜鉴辛通。 文登趁醮，不惮冒霜风。 来往近乎千里，投坛告、马钰姜公。 持孝道，宰公闻得，惠酒劳奇功。 虔诚，逢感应，醮仪才罢，仙现云中。 命丹青妙手，传写奇容。 从此住行坐卧，搜斡运、阴裹阳宫。 忘尘事，乡人钦羡，相重更相崇。 赠莱阳县众醮首 高密锺真，莱阳姜鉴，废坊辛氏名通。 邀予追荐，不避雪和风。 捧示众官书疏，跪领外、承顺诸公。
chunks.translated_text:
**Fearing the Fiery Household**
Unskilled at tending a family,
I shun the hearth’s entanglements.
A thousand dusty ties swept clean,
I rely on a tranquil heart—
furnace-tending cinnabar.
Beneath pine peaks,
by water’s edge and stone’s embrace,
I send my spirit soaring with rosy clouds.

That single spirit,
ever bright and pure,
roams carefree in serene indifference—
true joy without bound.
If compared to the bright moon,
the moon may be veiled by clouds.
If likened to a lone cloud’s freedom,
wind-tossed and adrift,
how pitiable its plight.
I, by grace, have crossed to the other shore—
no joy surpasses this.

**In Harmony with Ziyang’s Immortal Yuanzi Wei Xindao’s Rhyme**
A life of indolent ease,
a livelihood of blissful sloth,
each thought and impulse steeped in mercy.
Now I refuse
to pluck a leaf only to seek another branch.
Cast aside the pedant’s *zhi-hu-zhe-ye*—
truly recognize the lotus rising from the mire.
In leisure’s embrace,
I press my hand to my heart and ponder:
as if encountering a master physician.

Carefree,
truly at ease,
to attain immortal blessings,
I rely on the heart’s teacher.
My resolve stands firm as mountains,
unyielding to wayward shifts.
In daily practice, non-action and purity—
naturally, I grasp the East and West.
Some mystery,
once awakened, becomes clear—
though old, it is not too late.

**Returning to the Previous Rhyme**
Those who mourn the dead,
those who send off the departed,
should ponder the fox’s grief at the hare’s death.
Youth fades with spring’s passing—
cease clinging to blossoming boughs.
Gather your spirit,
cross to the other shore,
rise from the mire like water.
Turn toward true awakening,
for the heart is ailing—
seek the physician beyond the world.

The true physician
prescribes no medicine,
but splits the dark and chisels the dim—
this is the enlightened master.
Let the heart remain unstained,
familiar realms shift and change.
With spirit pure, tiger and dragon unite—
whether the red sun rises in the East or sets in the West,
free from sorrow,
on the road to Chang’an,
the Way is walked without delay.

**Departing the Multitude: Instructions to Disciples**
All speak of smoke dispersing,
of fire extinguished,
yet at the slightest touch, ignorance stirs.
Unaware, unknowing—
how can one depart the multitude?
The Dao is fundamentally easy to practice, easy to understand,
but the heart resists—
hard to grasp, hard to follow.
The demon of the heart obstructs,
great virtue unformed,
the square inch of the mind cannot attain clarity.

Go with the flow,
heed these instructions:
let go of right and wrong,
of self and others.
Alas, the walking corpses of bone—
what shame? What glory?
Hasten to save your own nature,
harmonize qi and spirit,
refine and solidify the true form.
In the numinous words,
the jade terrace and Penglai’s gardens—
the Isles of the Blessed lie ahead.

**In Praise of Master Liu of Hunyuan’s Ascension**
Young, he followed the crowd;
grown, he stood apart—
devoted to the registers of the Dao.
He inscribed talismans, chanted over water,
healed the sick, and rescued the imperiled.
His virtue, though hidden like a thief’s,
scorned splendor—
oyster-shell food and coarse robes.
He once encountered
Master Chongyang,
who transmitted to him the gateway to profound stillness.

Knowing
his merit and conduct complete,
he hastened to visit me,
setting the date of his return.
With a flick of his sleeve,
he departed at the appointed time.
In Pengcheng, all was settled—
Ma, swift as the wind,
composed a new verse.
Attaining longevity,
he ascended with the cloud-borne immortals,
riding a crane to the Jasper Pool.

**In Praise of True Man Chongyang’s Manifestation**
In the ancient prefecture of Dengzhou,
beyond the Gate of Immortals,
painted bridges and carriages could not pass.
Master Chongyang,
before the multitude, revealed his true nature.
He foretold that after twelve years,
Prefect He would meet his end.
Finding the path treacherous,
the people dismantled it,
commanding craftsmen to rebuild.

In Wendeng,
he appeared again—
upon a white turtle and lotus,
seated in empty space.
Magistrate Ni Manghu
beheld his true form.
Suddenly, he turned, reclining on his side—
auspicious clouds stirred,
and he returned to the immortal palace.
People vied to paint his likeness,
enshrining it in every home,
revered and honored everywhere.

**Again**
The Wondrous Practitioner,
Master Chongyang,
met his teacher, the Perfected Lü.
After ten years of perfecting the Dao,
he departed, riding the wind.
For twelve years, he descended thrice to the world,
his nature upright,
all affairs guided by impartiality.
In heaven, he manifested
the art of non-action,
surpassing and revealing the work of spontaneity.

In the *Complete Perfection* canon,
hidden within its depths,
mystery resides.
Discuss the dragon’s roar, the tiger’s howl,
the tender beauty of the infant and maiden.
Within the jade, golden light gleams—
the elixir congeals,
leaping forth from the numinous palace.
Let people awaken,
hasten to cultivate purity—
do not endure the world’s veneration.

**To Elders Xin the Fifth and Jiang the Fourth**
Surpassing wealth and distinction,
their conduct set them apart—
Jiang Jian and Xin Tong of Laiyang.
In Wendeng, they attended the jiao rites,
undaunted by frost and wind.
Traveling nearly a thousand li,
they sought the altar,
presenting their petition to Ma Yu and Jiang Gong.
Upholding filial piety,
the magistrate, hearing of this,
rewarded their extraordinary merit with fine wine.

Sincere and devout,
their prayers met with response—
as the jiao rites concluded,
an immortal appeared amidst the clouds.
They summoned a master painter
to capture his wondrous visage.
From then on, in motion and stillness,
they turned the wheel,
navigating the palace of yin and yang.
Forsaking worldly affairs,
their fellow villagers admired and revered them,
holding them in ever higher esteem.

**To the Leaders of the Laiyang County Jiao Ritual**
Zhong Zhen of Gaomi,
Jiang Jian of Laiyang,
and Xin Shi, known for restoring temples.
They invited me to perform the rites,
undaunted by snow and wind.
Presenting the official documents,
they knelt to receive them—
complying with the wishes of the assembled lords.

**When Others Suspect**
Like clay molded into form—
facing the knife, remain steadfast;
encountering medicine, stretch forth.
No need to argue right or wrong,
no need to weigh strength or weakness.
Master Chongyang taught me:
dispel the smoke and fire,
awaken from the false to cultivate the real.
Ever endure,
when provoked, do not contend—
truly become an immortal.

**Attaining True Joy**
A carefree wanderer,
a leisurely idler,
truly loathing glory and splendor.

chunks.original_text: 居环堵，一餐薄粥，须办十分功。 加持，非草草，玉山踏碎，金藏颐中。 要虎龙交媾，产出元容， 整顿精神惺洒，救亡灵、尽赴蓬宫。 人听劝，齐心乐善，释道一般崇。 赴登州黄箓大醮 松栢岩前，烟霞洞裹，清风吹动灵苗。 水升火降，大药自然烧。 歌舞相陪童稚，利名弃、不让渔樵。 忘人我，清贫为乐，怕底是尘嚣。 人来，求追荐，千言万语，苦苦相邀。 便加持斋戒，遥拜云寮。 祷告重阳师父，救亡灵、得上青霄。 鸾鹤引，孤魂滞魄，相从总逍遥。 文山七宝会众创庵告名因而示词 七宝庵中，三清门裹，全真堂建相当。 东西廊舍，堪可做云房。
chunks.translated_text:
Amidst bare walls they dwelt,
a single meal of thin gruel sufficed—
yet they mustered full and perfect effort.
Through empowerment, not carelessly,
they trampled the jade mountains to dust,
nurturing the golden treasury within.
They sought the coupling of tiger and dragon,
to birth the primal visage,
to gather and refine their spirit,
awakening and cleansing—
that all lost souls might be delivered,
ascending together to Penglai’s palace.
Let all heed this counsel,
unite in joyful goodness,
for Daoist and Buddhist alike are revered.

**Attending the Great Jiao Ritual at Huanglu, Dengzhou**
Before Pine-Cypress Crag,
within Mist-and-Cloud Grotto,
the pure breeze stirred the sacred sprouts.
Water ascends, fire descends—
the great elixir refines itself.
Songs and dances accompany the young,
while fame and profit are cast aside,
yielding not even to fisherman or woodcutter.
They forget self and other,
finding joy in pure poverty,
for what they fear most is the clamor of the dusty world.

When people come,
seeking deliverance for the departed,
with a thousand words, ten thousand pleas,
earnestly entreating—
they but strengthen their fasting and abstinence,
bowing from afar toward the cloud chambers.
They pray to Master Chongyang,
that lost souls may be saved,
ascending to the azure heavens.
Led by phoenix and crane,
orphaned spirits and lingering shades
follow together in carefree wandering.

**The Seven Treasures Assembly at Wenshan Establishes a Hermitage—Inscribed Reasons for Registration**
Within the Seven Treasures Hermitage,
behind the Three Clarities’ gate,
the Hall of Complete Perfection stands fittingly.
East and west verandas,
well-suited to serve as cloud chambers.

chunks.original_text: 凿石名为丹井，水甘美、有若琼浆。 玄玄处，修真环堵，幽雅不寻常。 云朋，并霞友，微中讲论，妙裹斟量。 处身心清静，便是仙方。 调息如同龟息，命灯内、性月圆光。 斋场上，文山道友，唱此满庭芳。 洞玄金玉集卷之十竟 #1以下十七首词牌均为『减字木兰花』。 #2以下二十五首词牌均为『桃源忆故人』。 #3此首词牌为『甘草子』。 #4以下四十首词牌均为『满庭芳』。
chunks.translated_text:
A stone is hewn to form the Elixir Well,
its waters sweet and fine,
like nectar divine.
In this most profound abode,
cultivating truth within secluded walls,
refined and serene beyond compare.

Cloud companions,
and rosy dawn friends,
in subtle discourse engage,
weighing mysteries with care.
When body and mind are pure and still,
this is the immortal’s way.

Regulate the breath as the tortoise does,
the lamp of life within,
the moon of nature round and bright.
In the ritual arena,
Daoist companions of Wenshan,
sing this *"Full Court of Fragrance."*

*Collected Writings on the Dao in Gold and Jade, Scroll Ten* concludes here.

#1 The following seventeen lyrics are set to the tune *"Reduced Characters Wood Orchid Flower."*
#2 The following twenty-five lyrics are set to the tune *"Peach Blossom Source Remembers an Old Friend."*
#3 This lyric is set to the tune *"Licorice Seedling."*
#4 The following forty lyrics are set to the tune *"Full Court of Fragrance."*
